apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: cds-blueprints-processor
    chart: cds-blueprints-processor-5.0.0
    release: dev-cds
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: cds-blueprints-processor
        release: dev-cds
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - cds-db
        - --container-name
        - message-router
        
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.2"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: cds-blueprints-processor-readiness
      containers:
        - name: cds-blueprints-processor
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/ccsdk-blueprintsprocessor:0.6.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          env:
          - name: APP_CONFIG_HOME
            value: /opt/app/onap/config
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          - containerPort: 9111
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            httpGet:
              path: /api/v1/execution-service/health-check
              port: 8080
              httpHeaders:
              - name: Authorization
                value: Basic Y2NzZGthcHBzOmNjc2RrYXBwcw==
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 20
            timeoutSeconds: 20
          
          readinessProbe:
            httpGet:
              path: /api/v1/execution-service/health-check
              port: 8080
              httpHeaders:
              - name: Authorization
                value: Basic Y2NzZGthcHBzOmNjc2RrYXBwcw==
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 10
            timeoutSeconds: 20
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/onap/config/application.properties
            name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor-config
            subPath: application.properties
          - mountPath: /opt/app/onap/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor-config
            subPath: logback.xml

          - mountPath: /opt/app/onap/config/ONAP_RootCA.cer
            name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor-config
            subPath: ONAP_RootCA.cer

          - mountPath: /opt/app/onap/blueprints/deploy
            name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor-blueprints
          resources:
                        null
                        
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor-configmap
            items:
            - key: application.properties
              path: application.properties
            - key: logback.xml
              path: logback.xml
            - key: ONAP_RootCA.cer
              path: ONAP_RootCA.cer
        - name: dev-cds-cds-blueprints-processor-blueprints
          persistentVolumeClaim:
            claimName: dev-cds-cds-blueprints
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-cds-cds-command-executor
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: cds-command-executor
    chart: cds-command-executor-5.0.0
    release: dev-cds
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: cds-command-executor
        release: dev-cds
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - cds-blueprints-processor
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.2"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: cds-command-executor-readiness
      containers:
        - name: cds-command-executor
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/ccsdk-commandexecutor:0.6.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 50051
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 50051
            initialDelaySeconds: 20
            periodSeconds: 20
            timeoutSeconds: 20
          
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 50051
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
            timeoutSeconds: 20
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/onap/blueprints/deploy
            name: dev-cds-cds-command-executor-blueprints
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-cds-cds-command-executor-blueprints
          persistentVolumeClaim:
            claimName: dev-cds-cds-blueprints
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-cds-cds-sdc-listener
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: cds-sdc-listener
    chart: cds-sdc-listener-5.0.0
    release: dev-cds
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: cds-sdc-listener
        release: dev-cds
    spec:
      initContainers:
        - command:
          - /root/ready.py
          args:
            - --container-name
            - sdc-be
            - --container-name
            - message-router
            - --container-name
            - cds-blueprints-processor
          env:
          - name: NAMESPACE
            valueFrom:
              fieldRef:
                apiVersion: v1
                fieldPath: metadata.namespace
          image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.2"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          name: cds-sdc-listener-readiness
      containers:
        - name: cds-sdc-listener
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/ccsdk-sdclistener:0.6.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          env:
          - name: APP_CONFIG_HOME
            value: /opt/app/onap/config
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          
          livenessProbe:
            httpGet:
              path: /api/v1/sdclistener/healthcheck
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          
          readinessProbe:
            httpGet:
              path: /api/v1/sdclistener/healthcheck
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /opt/app/onap/config/application.yaml
            name: dev-cds-cds-sdc-listener-config
            subPath: application.yaml
          - mountPath: /opt/app/onap/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-cds-cds-sdc-listener-config
            subPath: logback.xml
          resources:
                        null
                        
      volumes:
        - name: dev-cds-cds-sdc-listener-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-cds-cds-sdc-listener-configmap
            items:
            - key: application.yaml
              path: application.yaml
            - key: logback.xml
              path: logback.xml
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: onap-docker-registry-key
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-cds-cds-ui
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: cds-ui
    chart: cds-ui-5.0.0
    release: dev-cds
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: cds-ui
        release: dev-cds
        name: dev-cds-cds-ui
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: cds-ui
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/ccsdk-cds-ui-server:0.6.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
            - containerPort: 3000
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 3000
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          
          env:
            - name: HOST
              value: 0.0.0.0
            - name: APP_ACTION_DEPLOY_BLUEPRINT_GRPC_ENABLED
              value: "true"
            - name: API_BLUEPRINT_CONTROLLER_HTTP_BASE_URL
              value: http://cds-controller-blueprints:8080/api/v1
            - name: API_BLUEPRINT_CONTROLLER_HTTP_AUTH_TOKEN
              value: Basic Y2NzZGthcHBzOmNjc2RrYXBwcw==
            - name: API_BLUEPRINT_PROCESSOR_HHTP_BASE_URL
              value: http://cds-blueprints-processor-http:8080/api/v1
            - name: API_BLUEPRINT_PROCESSOR_HTTP_AUTH_TOKEN
              value: Basic Y2NzZGthcHBzOmNjc2RrYXBwcw==
            - name: API_BLUEPRINT_PROCESSOR_GRPC_HOST
              value: cds-blueprints-processor-grpc
            - name: API_BLUEPRINT_PROCESSOR_GRPC_PORT
              value: "9111"
            - name: API_BLUEPRINT_PROCESSOR_GRPC_AUTH_TOKEN
              value: Basic Y2NzZGthcHBzOmNjc2RrYXBwcw==
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 3000
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          volumeMounts:
            - mountPath: /etc/localtime
              name: localtime
              readOnly: true
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      # side car containers
        # - name: filebeat-onap
        #   image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
        #   imagePullPolicy: Always
        #   volumeMounts:
        #   - mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
        #     name: filebeat-conf
        #     subPath: filebeat.yml
        #   - mountPath: /home/esr/works/logs
        #     name: esr-server-logs
        #   - mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
        #     name: esr-server-filebeat
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        # - name: filebeat-conf
        #   configMap:
        #     name: dev-cds-cds-ui-esr-filebeat
        # - name: esr-server-logs
        #   emptyDir: {}
        # - name: esr-server-filebeat
        #   emptyDir: {}
        # - name: esrserver-log
        #   configMap:
        #     name: dev-cds-cds-ui-esr-esrserver-log
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: cds/charts/mariadb-galera/templates/statefulset.yaml
# Copyright  2018 Amdocs, Bell Canada
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and

apiVersion: apps/v1beta1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: dev-cds-cds-db
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: dev-cds-cds-db
    chart: "mariadb-galera-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-cds"
    heritage: "Tiller"
spec:
  serviceName: cds-db
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: dev-cds-cds-db
        chart: "mariadb-galera-5.0.0"
        release: "dev-cds"
        heritage: "Tiller"
      annotations:
        pod.alpha.kubernetes.io/initialized: "true"
    spec:
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: onap-docker-registry-key
      containers:
        - name: cds-db
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/adfinissygroup/k8s-mariadb-galera-centos:v002"
          imagePullPolicy: "Always"
          env:
            - name: POD_NAMESPACE
              valueFrom:
                fieldRef:
                  apiVersion: v1
                  fieldPath: metadata.namespace
            - name: MYSQL_USER
              value: "sdnctl"
            - name: MYSQL_PASSWORD
              valueFrom:
                secretKeyRef:
                  name: dev-cds-cds-db
                  key: user-password
            - name: MYSQL_DATABASE
              value: "sdnctl"
            - name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
              valueFrom:
                secretKeyRef:
                  name: dev-cds-cds-db
                  key: db-root-password
          ports:
          - containerPort: 3306
            name: cds-db
          - containerPort: 4444
            name: sst
          - containerPort: 4567
            name: replication
          - containerPort: 4568
            name: ist
          readinessProbe:
            exec:
              command:
              - /usr/share/container-scripts/mysql/readiness-probe.sh
            initialDelaySeconds: 15
            periodSeconds: 10
            timeoutSeconds: 5
          livenessProbe:
            exec:
              command: ["mysqladmin", "ping"]
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
            timeoutSeconds: 5
          resources:
                        {}
                        
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /var/lib/mysql
            name: dev-cds-cds-db-data
      initContainers:
        - name: mariadb-galera-prepare
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/busybox"
          imagePullPolicy: "Always"
          command: ["sh", "-c", "chown -R 27:27 /var/lib/mysql"]
          volumeMounts:
            - name: dev-cds-cds-db-data
              mountPath: /var/lib/mysql
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: dev-cds-cds-db-data
      labels:
        name: dev-cds-cds-db
        chart: "mariadb-galera-5.0.0"
        release: "dev-cds"
        heritage: "Tiller"
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - "ReadWriteOnce"

# Source: clamp/charts/clamp-backend/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp-filebeat-configmap
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp-backend
    chart: clamp-backend-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  filebeat.yml: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
    filebeat.prospectors:
    #it is mandatory, in our case it's log
    - input_type: log
      #This is the canolical path as mentioned in logback.xml, *.* means it will monitor all files in the directory.
      paths:
        - /var/log/onap/*/*/*/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*/*/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*/*.log
      #Files older than this should be ignored.In our case it will be 48 hours i.e. 2 days. It is a helping flag for clean_inactive
      ignore_older: 48h
      # Remove the registry entry for a file that is more than the specified time. In our case it will be 96 hours, i.e. 4 days. It will help to keep registry records with in limit
      clean_inactive: 96h
  
    # Name of the registry file. If a relative path is used, it is considered relative to the
    # data path. Else full qualified file name.
    #filebeat.registry_file: ${path.data}/registry
  
  
    output.logstash:
      #List of logstash server ip addresses with port number.
      #But, in our case, this will be the loadbalancer IP address.
      #For the below property to work the loadbalancer or logstash should expose 5044 port to listen the filebeat events or port in the property should be changed appropriately.
      hosts: ["log-ls:5044"]
      #If enable will do load balancing among availabe Logstash, automatically.
      loadbalance: true
  
      #The list of root certificates for server verifications.
      #If certificate_authorities is empty or not set, the trusted
      #certificate authorities of the host system are used.
      #ssl.certificate_authorities: $ssl.certificate_authorities
  
      #The path to the certificate for SSL client authentication. If the certificate is not specified,
      #client authentication is not available.
      #ssl.certificate: $ssl.certificate
  
      #The client certificate key used for client authentication.
      #ssl.key: $ssl.key
  
      #The passphrase used to decrypt an encrypted key stored in the configured key file
      #ssl.key_passphrase: $ssl.key_passphrase
---

    />\n\t<!-- Example evaluator filter applied against console appender -->\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_tim\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%d{&quot;yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX&quot;,
    UTC}\" />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_lvl\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%level\" />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_log\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%logger\"
    />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_mdc\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%replace(%replace(%mdc){'\\t','\\\\\\\\t'}){'\\n',
    '\\\\\\\\n'}\" />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_msg\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%replace(%replace(%msg){'\\t',
    '\\\\\\\\t'}){'\\n','\\\\\\\\n'}\" />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_exc\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%replace(%replace(%rootException){'\\t',
    '\\\\\\\\t'}){'\\n','\\\\\\\\n'}\" />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_mak\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%replace(%replace(%marker){'\\t',
    '\\\\\\\\t'}){'\\n','\\\\\\\\n'}\" />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"p_thr\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%thread\"
    />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"defaultPattern\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%nopexception${p_tim}\\t${p_thr}\\t${p_lvl}\\t${p_log}\\t${p_mdc}\\t${p_msg}\\t${p_exc}\\t${p_mak}\\t%n\"
    />\n\t<property\n\t\tname=\"debugPattern\"\n\t\tvalue=\"%nopexception${p_tim}|${p_lvl}|${p_mdc}|${p_exc}|%msg%n\"

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-configmap
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp-dash-es
    chart: clamp-dash-es-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  elasticsearch.yml: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
    # ======================== Elasticsearch Configuration =========================
    #
    # NOTE: Elasticsearch comes with reasonable defaults for most settings.
    #       Before you set out to tweak and tune the configuration, make sure you
    #       understand what are you trying to accomplish and the consequences.
    #
    # The primary way of configuring a node is via this file. This template lists
    # the most important settings you may want to configure for a production cluster.
    #
    # Please consult the documentation for further information on configuration options:
    # https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/index.html
    #
    # ---------------------------------- Cluster -----------------------------------
    #
    # Name of the Elasticsearch cluster.
    # A node can only join a cluster when it shares its cluster.name with all the other nodes in the cluster.
    # The default name is elasticsearch, but you should change it to an appropriate name which describes the
    # purpose of the cluster.
    #
    cluster.name: "clamp-dashboard"
    #
    # The port that other nodes in the cluster should use when communicating with this node.
    # Required for Elasticsearch's nodes running on different cluster nodes.
    # More : https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-transport.html
    #transport.publish_port:$transport.publish_port
    #
    # The host address to publish for nodes in the cluster to connect to.
    # Required for Elasticsearch's nodes running on different cluster nodes.
    # More : https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-transport.html
    #transport.publish_host:$transport.publish_host
    #
    # ------------------------------------ Node ------------------------------------
    #
    # It is better to provide different meaningfull names fot different elastic nodes.
    # By default, Elasticsearch will take the 7 first character of the randomly generated uuid used as the node id.
    # Note that the node id is persisted and does not change when a node restarts
    #
    #node.name: $node.name
    #
    # Add custom attributes to the node:
    #
    #node.attr.rack: r1
    #
    # ----------------------------------- Paths ------------------------------------
    #
    # The location of the data files of each index / shard allocated on the node. Can hold multiple locations separated by coma.
    # In production, we should not keep this default to "/elasticsearch/data", as on upgrading Elasticsearch, directory structure
    # may change & can deal to data loss.
    path.data: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
    #
    # Elasticsearch's log files location. In production, we should not keep this default to "/elasticsearch/logs",
    # as on upgrading Elasticsearch, directory structure may change.
    path.logs: /usr/share/elasticsearch/logs
    #
    # ----------------------------------- Memory -----------------------------------
    #
    # It is vitally important to the health of your node that none of the JVM is ever swapped out to disk.
    # Lock the memory on startup.
    #
    bootstrap.memory_lock: false
    #
    # Make sure that the heap size is set to about half the memory available
    # on the system and that the owner of the process is allowed to use this
    # limit.
    #
    # Elasticsearch performs poorly when the system is swapping the memory.
    #
    # ---------------------------------- Network -----------------------------------
    #
    # Set the bind address to a specific IP (IPv4 or IPv6):
    # In order to communicate and to form a cluster with nodes on other servers, your node will need to bind to a
    # non-loopback address.
    network.host: 0.0.0.0
    #
    # Set a custom port for HTTP: If required, default is 9200-9300
    #
    #http.port: $http.port
    #
    # For more information, consult the network module documentation.
    #
    # --------------------------------- Discovery ----------------------------------
    #
    # Pass an initial list of hosts to perform discovery when new node is started
    # To form a cluster with nodes on other servers, you have to provide a seed list of other nodes in the cluster
    # that are likely to be live and contactable.
    # By default, Elasticsearch will bind to the available loopback addresses and will scan ports 9300 to 9305 to try
    # to connect to other nodes running on the same server.
    #
    #$discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts
    #
    # This setting tells Elasticsearch to not elect a master unless there are enough master-eligible nodes
    # available. Only then will an election take place.
    # Prevent the "split brain" by configuring the majority of nodes (total number of master-eligible nodes / 2 + 1):
    discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes: 1
    #
    # For more information, consult the zen discovery module documentation.
    #
    # ---------------------------------- Gateway -----------------------------------
    #
    # Block initial recovery after a full cluster restart until N nodes are started:
    #
    #gateway.recover_after_nodes: 3
    #
    # For more information, consult the gateway module documentation.
    #
    # ---------------------------------- Various -----------------------------------
    #
    # Require explicit names when deleting indices:
    #
    #action.destructive_requires_name: true
    # Set a custom port for HTTP: If required, default is 9200-9300
    # This is used for REST APIs
    http.port: 9200
    # Port to bind for communication between nodes. Accepts a single value or a range.
    # If a range is specified, the node will bind to the first available port in the range.
    # Defaults to 9300-9400.
    # More info:
    transport.tcp.port: 9300
    #xpack.graph.enabled: false
    #Set to false to disable X-Pack graph features.
    #xpack.ml.enabled: false
    #Set to false to disable X-Pack machine learning features.
    #xpack.monitoring.enabled: false
    #Set to false to disable X-Pack monitoring features.
  
  
    #xpack.watcher.enabled: false
    #Set to false to disable Watcher.
  
    #xpack.license.self_generated.type: basic
    #xpack.security.enabled: false
  
    ## Search Guard
    #
    searchguard.enterprise_modules_enabled: false
    searchguard.ssl.transport.keystore_filepath: sg/node-0-keystore.jks
    searchguard.ssl.transport.truststore_filepath: sg/truststore.jks
    searchguard.ssl.transport.enforce_hostname_verification: false
  
    searchguard.authcz.admin_dn:
      - "CN=kirk,OU=client,O=client,l=tEst,C=De"

# Source: clamp/charts/clamp-dash-logstash/templates/configmap.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
# Modifications Copyright  2018 AT&T

# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at

#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp-dash-logstash
    chart: clamp-dash-logstash-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  logstash.yml: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
    http.host: "0.0.0.0"
    ## Path where pipeline configurations reside
    path.config: /usr/share/logstash/pipeline
  
    ## Type of queue : memeory based or file based
    #queue.type: persisted
    ## Size of queue
    #queue.max_bytes: 1024mb
    ## Setting true makes logstash check periodically for change in pipeline configurations
    config.reload.automatic: true
  
    ## xpack configurations
    #xpack.monitoring.elasticsearch.url: ["http://10.247.186.12:9200", "http://10.247.186.13:9200"]
    #xpack.monitoring.elasticsearch.username: elastic
    #xpack.monitoring.elasticsearch.password: changeme
    #xpack.monitoring.enabled: false
  pipeline.conf: "# Copyright (c) 2018 AT&T Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.\n#\n#
    Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n# you may not
    use this file except in compliance with the License.\n# You may obtain a copy of
    the License at\n#\n#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n#\n# Unless
    required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n# distributed under
    the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS
    OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n# See the License for the specific language
    governing permissions and\n# limitations under the License.\ninput {\n    http_poller
    {\n        urls => {\n            event_queue => {\n                method => get\n
    \               url => \"${dmaap_base_url}/events/${event_topic}/${dmaap_consumer_group}/${dmaap_consumer_id}?timeout=15000\"\n
    \               headers => {\n                    Accept => \"application/json\"\n
    \               }\n                topic => \"${event_topic}\"\n                tags
    => [ \"dmaap_source\" ]\n            }\n            notification_queue => {\n                method
    => get\n                url => \"${dmaap_base_url}/events/${notification_topic}/${dmaap_consumer_group}/${dmaap_consumer_id}?timeout=15000\"\n
    \               headers => {\n                    Accept => \"application/json\"\n
    \               }\n                topic => \"${notification_topic}\"\n                tags
    => [ \"dmaap_source\" ]\n            }\n            request_queue => {\n                method
    => get\n                url => \"${dmaap_base_url}/events/${request_topic}/${dmaap_consumer_group}/${dmaap_consumer_id}?timeout=15000\"\n
    \               headers => {\n                    Accept => \"application/json\"\n
    \               }\n                topic => \"${request_topic}\"\n                tags
    => [ \"dmaap_source\" ]\n            }\n        }\n        socket_timeout => 30\n
    \       request_timeout => 30\n        schedule => { \"every\" => \"1m\" }\n        codec
    => \"plain\"\n        cacert => \"/certs.d/aafca.pem\"\n    }\n}\n\n\nfilter {\n
    \   # avoid noise if no entry in the list\n    if [message] == \"[]\" {\n        drop
    { }\n    }\n\n    if [http_request_failure] or [@metadata][code] != 200 {\n       mutate
    {\n       \t   add_tag => [ \"error\" ]\n       }\n    }\n\n    if \"dmaap_source\"
    in [@metadata][request][tags] {\n        #\n        # Dmaap provides a json list,
    whose items are Strings containing the event\n        # provided to Dmaap, which
    itself is an escaped json.\n        #\n        # We first need to parse the json
    as we have to use the plaintext as it cannot\n        # work with list of events,
    then split that list into multiple string events,\n        # that we then transform
    into json.\n        #\n        json {\n            source => \"[message]\"\n            target
    => \"message\"\n        }\n\n        split {\n            field => \"message\"\n
    \       }\n        json {\n            source => \"message\"\n        }\n        mutate
    {\n            remove_field => [ \"message\" ]\n        }\n    }\n\n    #\n    #
    Some timestamps are expressed as milliseconds, some are in microseconds\n    #\n
    \   if [closedLoopAlarmStart] {\n        ruby {\n            code => \"\n            if
    event.get('closedLoopAlarmStart').to_s.to_i(10) > 9999999999999\n              event.set('closedLoopAlarmStart',
    event.get('closedLoopAlarmStart').to_s.to_i(10) / 1000)\n            else\n              event.set('closedLoopAlarmStart',
    event.get('closedLoopAlarmStart').to_s.to_i(10))\n            end\n            \"\n
    \       }\n        date {\n            match => [ \"closedLoopAlarmStart\", UNIX_MS
    ]\n            target => \"closedLoopAlarmStart\"\n        }\n    }\n\n    if [closedLoopAlarmEnd]
    {\n        ruby {\n            code => \"\n            if event.get('closedLoopAlarmEnd').to_s.to_i(10)
    > 9999999999999\n              event.set('closedLoopAlarmEnd', event.get('closedLoopAlarmEnd').to_s.to_i(10)
    / 1000)\n            else\n              event.set('closedLoopAlarmEnd', event.get('closedLoopAlarmEnd').to_s.to_i(10))\n
    \           end\n            \"\n        }\n        date {\n            match =>
    [ \"closedLoopAlarmEnd\", UNIX_MS ]\n            target => \"closedLoopAlarmEnd\"\n
    \       }\n\n    }\n\n\n    #\n    # Notification time are expressed under the form
    \"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss\", which\n    # is close to ISO8601, but lacks of T as spacer:
    \"yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss\"\n    #\n    if [notificationTime] {\n        mutate {\n
    \           gsub => [\n                \"notificationTime\", \" \", \"T\"\n                ]\n
    \       }\n        date {\n            match => [ \"notificationTime\", ISO8601
    ]\n            target => \"notificationTime\"\n        }\n    }\n\n\n    #\n    #
    Renaming some fields for readability\n    #\n        if [AAI][generic-vnf.vnf-name]
    {\n            mutate {\n                add_field => { \"vnfName\" => \"%{[AAI][generic-vnf.vnf-name]}\"
    }\n            }\n        }\n        if [AAI][generic-vnf.vnf-type] {\n            mutate
    {\n                add_field => { \"vnfType\" => \"%{[AAI][generic-vnf.vnf-type]}\"
    }\n            }\n        }\n        if [AAI][vserver.vserver-name] {\n            mutate
    {\n                add_field => { \"vmName\" => \"%{[AAI][vserver.vserver-name]}\"
    }\n            }\n        }\n        if [AAI][complex.city] {\n            mutate
    {\n                add_field => { \"locationCity\" => \"%{[AAI][complex.city]}\"
    }\n            }\n        }\n        if [AAI][complex.state] {\n            mutate
    {\n                add_field => { \"locationState\" => \"%{[AAI][complex.state]}\"
    }\n            }\n        }\n\n\n    #\n    # Adding some flags to ease aggregation\n
    \   #\n    if [closedLoopEventStatus] =~ /(?i)ABATED/ {\n        mutate {\n            add_field
    => { \"flagAbated\" => \"1\" }\n        }\n    }\n    if [notification] =~ /^.*?(?:\\b|_)FINAL(?:\\b|_).*?(?:\\b|_)FAILURE(?:\\b|_).*?$/
    {\n        mutate {\n            add_field => { \"flagFinalFailure\" => \"1\" }\n
    \       }\n    }\n\n\n    if \"error\" not in [@metadata][request][tags]{\n        #\n
    \       # Creating data for a secondary index\n        #\n        clone {\n            clones
    => [ \"event-cl-aggs\" ]\n            add_tag => [ \"event-cl-aggs\" ]\n        }\n
    \       \n        if  \"event-cl-aggs\" in [@metadata][request][tags]{\n            #\n
    \           # we only need a few fields for aggregations; remove all fields from
    clone except :\n            #   vmName,vnfName,vnfType,requestID,closedLoopAlarmStart,
    closedLoopControlName,closedLoopAlarmEnd,abated,nbrDmaapevents,finalFailure\n            #\n
    \           prune {\n                whitelist_names => [\"^@.*$\",\"^topic$\",\"^type$\",\"^tags$\",\"^flagFinalFailure$\",\"^flagAbated$\",\"^locationState$\",\"^locationCity$\",\"^vmName$\",\"^vnfName$\",\"^vnfType$\",\"^requestID$\",\"^closedLoopAlarmStart$\",\"^closedLoopControlName$\",\"^closedLoopAlarmEnd$\",\"^target$\",\"^target_type$\",\"^triggerSourceName$\",\"^policyScope$\",\"^policyName$\",\"^policyVersion$\"]\n
    \           }\n        \n        }\n    }\n}\n\n\noutput {\n    stdout {\n        codec
    => rubydebug\n    }\n\n    if \"error\" in [tags] {\n        elasticsearch {\n            codec
    => \"json\"\n            hosts => [\"${elasticsearch_base_url}\"]\n            user
    => [\"${logstash_user}\"]\n            password => [\"${logstash_pwd}\"]\n            index
    => \"errors-%{+YYYY.MM.DD}\"\n            doc_as_upsert => true\n        }\n\n    }
    else if \"event-cl-aggs\" in [tags] {\n        elasticsearch {\n            codec
    => \"json\"\n            hosts => [\"${elasticsearch_base_url}\"]\n            user
    => [\"${logstash_user}\"]\n            password => [\"${logstash_pwd}\"]\n            document_id
    => \"%{requestID}\"\n            index => \"events-cl-%{+YYYY.MM.DD}\" # creates
    daily indexes for control loop\n            doc_as_upsert => true\n            action
    => \"update\"\n        }\n\n    } else {\n        elasticsearch {\n            codec
    => \"json\"\n            hosts => [\"${elasticsearch_base_url}\"]\n            user
    => [\"${logstash_user}\"]\n            password => [\"${logstash_pwd}\"]\n            index
    => \"events-%{+YYYY.MM.DD}\" # creates daily indexes\n            doc_as_upsert
    => true\n        }\n    }\n}\n"
---
# Source: clamp/charts/mariadb/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: clamp-mariadb-conf-configmap
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: mariadb
    chart: mariadb-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  my.cnf: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
    # Example MySQL config file for medium systems.
    #
    # This is for a system with memory 8G where MySQL plays
    # an important part, or systems up to 128M where MySQL is used together with
    # other programs (such as a web server)
    #
    # In this file, you can use all long options that a program supports.
    # If you want to know which options a program supports, run the program
    # with the "--help" option.
  
    # The following options will be passed to all MySQL clients
    ##[client]
    ##user            = root
    ##port            = 3306
    ##socket          = //opt/app/mysql/mysql.sock
  
    # Here follows entries for some specific programs
  
    # The MySQL server
    [mysqld]
    ##performance_schema
  
    slow_query_log =ON
    long_query_time =2
    slow_query_log_file =//var/lib/mysql/slow_query.log
    ##basedir         = //opt/app/mysql/product/mariadb-10.1.11-linux-x86_64
    ##datadir         = //opt/app/mysql/data
    ##port            = 3306
    ##socket          = //opt/app/mysql/mysql.sock
    skip-external-locking
    explicit_defaults_for_timestamp = true
    skip-symbolic-links
    local-infile = 0
    #ignore_db_dir=lost+found
    key_buffer_size = 16M
    max_allowed_packet = 4M
    table_open_cache = 100
    sort_buffer_size = 512K
    net_buffer_length = 8K
    read_buffer_size = 256K
    read_rnd_buffer_size = 512K
    myisam_sort_buffer_size = 8M
    max_connections = 500
    lower_case_table_names = 1
    thread_stack = 256K
    thread_cache_size = 25
    query_cache_size = 8M
    query_cache_type = 0
    query_prealloc_size = 512K
    query_cache_limit = 1M
  
    # Password validation
    ##plugin-load-add=simple_password_check.so
    ##simple_password_check_other_characters=0
  
    # Audit Log settings
    plugin-load-add=server_audit.so
    server_audit=FORCE_PLUS_PERMANENT
    server_audit_file_path=//var/lib/mysql/audit.log
    server_audit_file_rotate_size=50M
    server_audit_events=CONNECT,QUERY,TABLE
    server_audit_logging=on
  
    # Don't listen on a TCP/IP port at all. This can be a security enhancement,
    # if all processes that need to connect to mysqld run on the same host.
    # All interaction with mysqld must be made via Unix sockets or named pipes.
    # Note that using this option without enabling named pipes on Windows
    # (via the "enable-named-pipe" option) will render mysqld useless!
    #
    #skip-networking
  
    # Replication Master Server (default)
    # binary logging is required for replication
    ##log-bin=//var/lib/mysql/mysql-bin
  
    # binary logging format - mixed recommended
    binlog_format=row
  
    # required unique id between 1 and 2^32 - 1
    # defaults to 1 if master-host is not set
    # but will not function as a master if omitted
  
    # Replication Slave (comment out master section to use this)
    #
    # To configure this host as a replication slave, you can choose between
    # two methods :
    #
    # 1) Use the CHANGE MASTER TO command (fully described in our manual) -
    #    the syntax is:
    #
    #    CHANGE MASTER TO MASTER_HOST=<host>, MASTER_PORT=<port>,
    #    MASTER_USER=<user>, MASTER_PASSWORD=<password> ;
    #
    #    where you replace <host>, <user>, <password> by quoted strings and
    #    <port> by the master's port number (3306 by default).
    #
    #    Example:
    #
    #    CHANGE MASTER TO MASTER_HOST='125.564.12.1', MASTER_PORT=3306,
    #    MASTER_USER='joe', MASTER_PASSWORD='secret';
    #
    # OR
    #
    # 2) Set the variables below. However, in case you choose this method, then
    #    start replication for the first time (even unsuccessfully, for example
    #    if you mistyped the password in master-password and the slave fails to
    #    connect), the slave will create a master.info file, and any later
    #    change in this file to the variables' values below will be ignored and
    #    overridden by the content of the master.info file, unless you shutdown
    #    the slave server, delete master.info and restart the slaver server.
    #    For that reason, you may want to leave the lines below untouched
    #    (commented) and instead use CHANGE MASTER TO (see above)
    #
    # required unique id between 2 and 2^32 - 1
    # (and different from the master)
    # defaults to 2 if master-host is set
    # but will not function as a slave if omitted
    #server-id       = 2
    #
    # The replication master for this slave - required
    #master-host     =   <hostname>
    #
    # The username the slave will use for authentication when connecting
    # to the master - required
    #master-user     =   <username>
    #
    # The password the slave will authenticate with when connecting to
    # the master - required
    #master-password =   <password>
    #
    # The port the master is listening on.
    # optional - defaults to 3306
    #master-port     =  <port>
    #
    # binary logging - not required for slaves, but recommended
    #log-bin=mysql-bin
  
    # Uncomment the following if you are using InnoDB tables
    ##innodb_data_home_dir = //opt/app/mysql/data
    ##innodb_data_file_path = ibdata1:20M:autoextend:max:32G
    ##innodb_log_group_home_dir = //opt/app/mysql/iblogs
    # You can set .._buffer_pool_size up to 50 - 80 %
    # of RAM but beware of setting memory usage too high
    innodb_buffer_pool_size = 128M
    #innodb_additional_mem_pool_size = 2M
    # Set .._log_file_size to 25 % of buffer pool size
    innodb_log_file_size = 10M
    innodb_log_files_in_group = 3
    innodb_log_buffer_size = 8M
    #innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit = 1
    innodb_lock_wait_timeout = 50
    innodb_autoextend_increment = 100
    expire_logs_days = 8
    open_files_limit = 2000
    transaction-isolation=READ-COMMITTED
    ####### Galera parameters #######
    ## Galera Provider configuration
    wsrep_provider=/usr/lib/galera/libgalera_smm.so
    wsrep_provider_options="gcache.size=128M; gcache.page_size=10M"
    ## Galera Cluster configuration
    wsrep_cluster_name="MSO-automated-tests-cluster"
    wsrep_cluster_address="gcomm://"
    #wsrep_cluster_address="gcomm://mariadb1,mariadb2,mariadb3"
    ##wsrep_cluster_address="gcomm://192.169.3.184,192.169.3.185,192.169.3.186"
    ## Galera Synchronization configuration
    wsrep_sst_method=rsync
    #wsrep_sst_method=xtrabackup-v2
    #wsrep_sst_auth="sstuser:Mon#2o!6"
    ## Galera Node configuration
    wsrep_node_name="mariadb1"
    ##wsrep_node_address="192.169.3.184"
    wsrep_on=OFF
    ## Status notification
    #wsrep_notify_cmd=/opt/app/mysql/bin/wsrep_notify
    #######
  
  
    [mysqldump]
    quick
    max_allowed_packet = 16M
  
    [mysql]
    no-auto-rehash
    # Remove the next comment character if you are not familiar with SQL
    #safe-updates
  
    [myisamchk]
    key_buffer_size = 20971520
  
    ##[mysqlhotcopy]
    ##interactive-timeout
    ##[mysqld_safe]
    ##malloc-lib=//opt/app/mysql/local/lib/libjemalloc.so.1
    ##log-error=//opt/app/mysql/log/mysqld.log
  
#
---
# Source: clamp/charts/mariadb/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: clamp-entrypoint-bulkload-configmap
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: mariadb
    chart: mariadb-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  create-db.sql: |+
    #
    # Create CLDS database objects (tables, etc.)
    #
    #
    CREATE DATABASE `cldsdb4`;
    USE `cldsdb4`;
    DROP USER 'clds';
    CREATE USER 'clds';
    GRANT ALL on cldsdb4.* to 'clds' identified by 'sidnnd83K' with GRANT OPTION;
    FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
  
  create-tables.sql: "\n    create table hibernate_sequence (\n       next_val bigint\n
    \   ) engine=InnoDB;\n\n    insert into hibernate_sequence values ( 1 );\n\n    create
    table loop_logs (\n       id bigint not null,\n        log_component varchar(255)
    not null,\n        log_instant datetime(6) not null,\n        log_type varchar(255)
    not null,\n        message MEDIUMTEXT not null,\n        loop_id varchar(255) not
    null,\n        primary key (id)\n    ) engine=InnoDB;\n\n    create table loops
    (\n       name varchar(255) not null,\n        blueprint_yaml MEDIUMTEXT not null,\n
    \       dcae_blueprint_id varchar(255),\n        dcae_deployment_id varchar(255),\n
    \       dcae_deployment_status_url varchar(255),\n        global_properties_json
    json,\n        last_computed_state varchar(255) not null,\n        model_properties_json
    json,\n        operational_policy_schema json,\n        svg_representation MEDIUMTEXT,\n
    \       primary key (name)\n    ) engine=InnoDB;\n\n    create table loops_microservicepolicies
    (\n       loop_id varchar(255) not null,\n        microservicepolicy_id varchar(255)
    not null,\n        primary key (loop_id, microservicepolicy_id)\n    ) engine=InnoDB;\n\n
    \   create table micro_service_policies (\n       name varchar(255) not null,\n
    \       json_representation json not null,\n        model_type varchar(255) not
    null,\n        policy_tosca MEDIUMTEXT not null,\n        properties json,\n        shared
    bit not null,\n        primary key (name)\n    ) engine=InnoDB;\n\n    create table
    operational_policies (\n       name varchar(255) not null,\n        configurations_json
    json,\n        loop_id varchar(255) not null,\n        primary key (name)\n    )
    engine=InnoDB;\n\n    alter table loop_logs \n       add constraint FK1j0cda46aickcaoxqoo34khg2
    \n       foreign key (loop_id) \n       references loops (name);\n\n    alter table
    loops_microservicepolicies \n       add constraint FKem7tp1cdlpwe28av7ef91j1yl \n
    \      foreign key (microservicepolicy_id) \n       references micro_service_policies
    (name);\n\n    alter table loops_microservicepolicies \n       add constraint FKsvx91jekgdkfh34iaxtjfgebt
    \n       foreign key (loop_id) \n       references loops (name);\n\n    alter table
    operational_policies \n       add constraint FK1ddoggk9ni2bnqighv6ecmuwu \n       foreign
    key (loop_id) \n       references loops (name);\n"
---

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: clamp-entrypoint-initdb-configmap
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: mariadb
    chart: mariadb-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  bootstrap-database.sh: "#!/bin/sh\n\n###\n# ============LICENSE_START=======================================================\n#
    ONAP CLAMP\n# ================================================================================\n#
    Copyright (C) 2017 AT&T Intellectual Property. All rights\n#                             reserved.\n#
    ================================================================================\n#
    Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n# you may not
    use this file except in compliance with the License.\n# You may obtain a copy of
    the License at\n#\n# http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n#\n# Unless required
    by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n# distributed under the License
    is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
    KIND, either express or implied.\n# See the License for the specific language governing
    permissions and\n# limitations under the License.\n# ============LICENSE_END============================================\n#
    ===================================================================\n# \n###\n\nmysql
    -uroot -p$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD -f < /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/bulkload/create-db.sql\n##
    New model creation \nmysql -uroot -p$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD -f cldsdb4 < /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/bulkload/create-tables.sql\n"
---
# Source: clamp/templates/configmap.yaml

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp
    chart: clamp-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  nginx.conf: |
    server {
  
      listen 443 default ssl;
      ssl_protocols TLSv1.2;
      ssl_certificate /etc/ssl/clamp.pem;
      ssl_certificate_key /etc/ssl/clamp.key;
      ssl_verify_client optional_no_ca;
        location /restservices/clds/ {
            proxy_pass https://clamp-backend:443;
            proxy_set_header X-SSL-Cert $ssl_client_escaped_cert;
        }
  
      location / {
        root   /usr/share/nginx/html;
        index  index.html index.htm;
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html;
      }
  
      error_page   500 502 503 504  /50x.html;
  
      location = /50x.html {
        root   /usr/share/nginx/html;
      }
  
    }
---

  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  hostPath:
    path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-clamp/clamp/dashboard-elasticsearch/data

  namespace: onap

    app: clamp-dash-es

# Source: clamp/charts/clamp-backend/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
# Modifications Copyright  2018 AT&T
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp-backend
    chart: clamp-backend-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: clamp-backend
        release: dev-clamp
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - mariadb
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: clamp-backend-readiness
      containers:
        # side car containers
        - name: clamp-backend-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-logs
            mountPath: /var/log/onap
        - name: clamp-backend
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/clamp-backend:4.1.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          args:
            - "-Dcom.att.eelf.logging.file=file:/opt/clamp/logback.xml"
            - ""
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8443
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8443
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 10
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8443
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-logs
            mountPath: /var/log/onap
          - mountPath: /opt/clamp/sdc-controllers-config.json
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-config
            subPath: sdc-controllers-config.json
          - mountPath: /opt/clamp/logback.xml
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-config
            subPath: logback.xml
          env:
            - name: SPRING_APPLICATION_JSON
              valueFrom:
                configMapKeyRef:
                  name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend
                  key: spring_application_json
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend
            items:
            - key: sdc-controllers-config.json
              path: sdc-controllers-config.json
            - key: logback.xml
              path: logback.xml
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-backend-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-clamp-clamp-backend-logs
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: clamp/charts/clamp-dash-es/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
# Modifications Copyright  2018 AT&T
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp-dash-es
    chart: clamp-dash-es-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: clamp-dash-es
        release: dev-clamp
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        - |
          sysctl -w vm.max_map_count=262144
          mkdir -p /usr/share/elasticsearch/logs
          mkdir -p /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          chmod -R 777 /usr/share/elasticsearch
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        image: registry.hub.docker.com/library/busybox:latest
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: init-sysctl
        volumeMounts:
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-logs
          mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/logs/
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-data
          mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data/
      containers:
        - name: clamp-dash-es
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/clamp-dashboard-elasticsearch:4.1.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 9200
            name: cdash-es
          - containerPort: 9300
            name: cdash-es2
# disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 9200
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 9300
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/config/elasticsearch.yml
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-config
            subPath: elasticsearch.yml
          - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data/
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-data
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-configmap
            items:
            - key: elasticsearch.yml
              path: elasticsearch.yml
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-data
          persistentVolumeClaim:
            claimName: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-es-logs
          hostPath:
            path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-clamp/clamp
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-kibana
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp-dash-kibana
    chart: clamp-dash-kibana-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: clamp-dash-kibana
        release: dev-clamp
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - clamp-dash-es
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: clamp-dash-kibana-readiness
      containers:
        - name: clamp-dash-kibana
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/clamp-dashboard-kibana:4.1.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 5601
            name: cdash-kibana
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 5601
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
# disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 5601
            initialDelaySeconds: 360
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /usr/share/kibana/config/kibana.yml
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-kibana
            subPath: kibana.yml
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-kibana-aaf-pem-certs
            mountPath: /usr/share/kibana/config/keystore/
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-kibana
          configMap:
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-kibana
            items:
            - key: kibana.yml
              path: kibana.yml
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-kibana-aaf-pem-certs
          secret:
            secretName: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-kibana-aaf-pem-keys
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp-dash-logstash
    chart: clamp-dash-logstash-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: clamp-dash-logstash
        release: dev-clamp
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - clamp-dash-es
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: clamp-dash-logstash-readiness
      containers:
        - name: clamp-dash-logstash
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/clamp-dashboard-logstash:4.1.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          env:
          - name: dmaap_consumer_group
            value: "clampdashboard"
          - name: dmaap_consumer_id
            value: "clampdashboard"
          - name: event_topic
            value: "DCAE-CL-EVENT"
          - name: notification_topic
            value: "POLICY-CL-MGT"
          - name: request_topic
            value: "APPC-CL"
          - name: dmaap_base_url
            value: https://message-router.onap:3905
          - name: logstash_user
            value: "logstash"
          - name: logstash_pwd
            value: "logstash"
          - name: elasticsearch_base_url
            value: "http://cdash-es.onap.svc.cluster.local:9200"
          ports:
          - containerPort: 9600
            name: cdash-ls
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 9600
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
# disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 9600
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 10
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /usr/share/logstash/config/logstash.yml
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash
            subPath: logstash.yml
          - mountPath: /usr/share/logstash/pipeline/logstash.conf
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash
            subPath: pipeline.conf
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash-aaf-certs
            mountPath: /certs.d/
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash
          configMap:
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash
            items:
            - key: logstash.yml
              path: logstash.yml
            - key: pipeline.conf
              path: pipeline.conf
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash-aaf-certs
          secret:
            secretName: dev-clamp-clamp-dash-logstash-aaf-keys

      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-mariadb
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: mariadb
    chart: mariadb-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: mariadb
        release: dev-clamp
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: mariadb
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/mariadb:10.3.12"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 3306
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 3306
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 3306
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
            - name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
              valueFrom:
                secretKeyRef:
                  name: dev-clamp-mariadb
                  key: db-root-password
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/load-sql-files-tests-automation.sh
            name: docker-entrypoint-initdb
            subPath: load-sql-files-tests-automation.sh
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/drop/
            name: docker-entrypoint-clds-drop
          - mountPath: /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/bulkload/
            name: docker-entrypoint-bulkload
          - mountPath: /etc/mysql/conf.d/conf1/
            name:  clamp-mariadb-conf
          - mountPath: /var/lib/mysql
            name: clamp-mariadb-data
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: clamp-mariadb-data
          persistentVolumeClaim:
            claimName: dev-clamp-mariadb
        - name: docker-entrypoint-initdb
          configMap:
            name: clamp-entrypoint-initdb-configmap
        - name: docker-entrypoint-clds-drop
          configMap:
            name: clamp-entrypoint-drop-configmap
        - name: docker-entrypoint-bulkload
          configMap:
            name: clamp-entrypoint-bulkload-configmap
        - name: clamp-mariadb-conf
          configMap:
            name: clamp-mariadb-conf-configmap
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-clamp-clamp
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: clamp
    chart: clamp-5.0.0
    release: dev-clamp
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: clamp
        release: dev-clamp
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - clamp-backend
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: clamp-readiness
      containers:
        # side car containers
        - name: clamp-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-logs
            mountPath: /var/log/nginx/
        - name: clamp
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/clamp-frontend:4.1.3"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 443
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 443
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 10
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 443
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-clamp-clamp-logs
            mountPath: /var/log/nginx/
          - mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d/nginx.conf
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-config
            subPath: nginx.conf
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-clamp-clamp
            items:
            - key: nginx.conf
              path: nginx.conf
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-clamp-clamp-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-clamp-clamp-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-clamp-clamp-logs
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"

1. Get the application URL by running these commands:
  export NODE_PORT=$(kubectl get --namespace onap -o jsonpath="{.spec.ports[0].nodePort}" services clamp)
  export NODE_IP=$(kubectl get nodes --namespace onap -o jsonpath="{.items[0].status.addresses[0].address}")
  echo http://$NODE_IP:$NODE_PORT

apiVersion: v1

metadata:
  name: cli
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: cli
    chart: cli-5.0.0
    release: dev-cli
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  type: NodePort
  ports:
    - port: 8080
      targetPort: 80
      nodePort: 30260
      name: cli8080
    - port: 9090
      targetPort: 8080
      nodePort: 30271
      name: cli9090
  selector:
    app: cli

  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: cli
    chart: cli-5.0.0
    release: dev-cli
    heritage: Tiller

  template:

      labels:
        app: cli
        release: dev-cli
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: cli
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/cli:3.0.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 80
          - containerPort: 8080

          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container

              port: 80
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 80
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
            - name: OPEN_CLI_MODE
              value: "daemon"
          resources:
                        {}

      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"

1. Get the application URL by running these commands:
  export NODE_PORT=$(kubectl get --namespace onap -o jsonpath="{.spec.ports[0].nodePort}" services cli)
  export NODE_IP=$(kubectl get nodes --namespace onap -o jsonpath="{.items[0].status.addresses[0].address}")
  echo http://$NODE_IP:$NODE_PORT

[debug] SERVER: "127.0.0.1:40619"

metadata:
  name: dev-consul-consul-certs-secret
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: consul
    chart: consul-5.0.0
    release: dev-consul
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  client-cert-onap.crt.pem: 
  client-cert-onap.key.pem: 
---
# Source: consul/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-consul-consul-scripts-configmap
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: consul
    chart: consul-5.0.0
    release: dev-consul
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  aai-search-storage-write-doc.txt: |
    {
            "vnfId" : "testwrite",
            "device" : "10.198.1.31",
            "timestamp" : "2017-08-23T19:13:56Z",
            "jdmTotalMem" : "2097152",
            "jdmAvailableMem" : "1877272",
            "jdmUserCpu" : "16",
            "jdmSystemCpu" : "3"
    }
  aai-search-storage-write-script.sh: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    if curl -s -X PUT http://aai-elasticsearch:9200/searchhealth/stats/testwrite -d @/consul/scripts/aai-search-storage-write-doc.txt | grep '\"created\":true'; then
       if curl -s -X DELETE http://aai-elasticsearch:9200/searchhealth/stats/testwrite | grep '\"failed\":0'; then
          if curl -s -X GET http://aai-elasticsearch:9200/searchhealth/stats/testwrite | grep '\"found\":false'; then
             echo Successful PUT, DELETE, GET from Search Document Storage 2>&1
             exit 0
          else
             echo Failed GET from Search Document Storage 2>&1
             exit 1
          fi
       else
          echo Failed DELETE from Search Document Storage 2>&1
          exit 1
       fi
    else
       echo Failed PUT from Search Document Storage 2>&1
       exit 1
    fi
  appc-dbhost-script.sh: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    APPC_DBHOST_POD=$(/consul/bin/kubectl -n onap  get pod | grep -o "appc-dbhost-[^[:space:]]*")
    if [ -n "$APPC_DBHOST_POD" ]; then
       if /consul/bin/kubectl -n onap exec -it $APPC_DBHOST_POD -- ./healthcheck.sh |grep -i "mysqld is alive"; then
          echo Success. APPC DBHost is running. 2>&1
          exit 0
       else
          echo Failed. APPC DBHost is not running. 2>&1
          exit 1
       fi
    else
       echo Failed. APPC DBHost is offline. 2>&1
       exit 1
    fi
  clamp-mariadb-script.sh: |+
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    NAME=$(/consul/bin/kubectl -n onap get pod | grep -o "[^[:space:]]*-clampdb[^[:space:]]*")
  
       if [ -n "$NAME" ]; then
           if /consul/bin/kubectl -n onap exec -it $NAME -- bash -c 'mysqladmin status -u root -p$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD' > /dev/null; then
             echo Success. CLAMP DBHost is running. 2>&1
             exit 0
          else
             echo Failed. CLAMP DBHost is not running. 2>&1
             exit 1
          fi
       else
          echo Failed. CLAMP DBHost is offline. 2>&1
          exit 1
       fi
  
  data-router-script.sh: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at

    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    NAME=$(/consul/bin/kubectl -n onap get pod | grep -o "aai-data-router[^[:space:]]*")
  
    if [ -n "$NAME" ]; then
       if /consul/bin/kubectl -n onap exec -it $NAME -- ps -efww | grep 'java' | grep 'data-router' > /dev/null; then
  
          echo Success. Synapse process is running. 2>&1
          exit 0
       else
          echo Failed. Synapse process is not running. 2>&1
          exit 1
       fi
    else
       echo Failed. Synapse container is offline. 2>&1
       exit 1
    fi

    kafkapod=$(/consul/bin/kubectl -n onap get pod | grep -o "[^[:space:]]*-message-router-kafka-[^[:space:]]*")
    if [ -n "$kafkapod" ]; then

  sdc-be-script.sh: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    ## Query the health check API.
    HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINT="http://sdc-fe:8181/sdc1/rest/healthCheck"
    HEALTH_CHECK_RESPONSE=$(curl -s $HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINT)
  
    ## Strip out the ON_BOARDING section from the response XML (otherwise we will
    ## get duplicate results when we search for component BE) and check to see if
    ## the BE component is reported as up.
    READY=$(echo "$HEALTH_CHECK_RESPONSE" | sed '/ON_BOARDING/,/]/d' | grep -A 1 "BE" | grep "UP")
  
    if [ -n $READY ]; then
      echo "Query against health check endpoint: $HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINT"
      echo "Produces response: $HEALTH_CHECK_RESPONSE"
      echo "Application is not in an available state"
      return 2
    else
      echo "Application is available."
      return 0
    fi
  sdc-cs-script.sh: |
    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.

    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    ## Query the health check API.
    HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINT="http://sdc-fe:8181/sdc1/rest/healthCheck"
    HEALTH_CHECK_RESPONSE=$(curl -s $HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINT)
  
    ## Strip out the ON_BOARDING section from the response XML (otherwise we will
    ## get duplicate results when we search for component CASSANDRA) and check to see if
    ## the CASSANDRA component is reported as up.
    READY=$(echo "$HEALTH_CHECK_RESPONSE" | sed '/ON_BOARDING/,/]/d' | grep -A 1 "CASSANDRA" | grep "UP")
  
    if [ -n $READY ]; then
      echo "Query against health check endpoint: $HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINT"
      echo "Produces response: $HEALTH_CHECK_RESPONSE"
      echo "Application is not in an available state"
      return 2
    else
      echo "Application is available."
      return 0
    fi

    # Copyright  2018  AT&T, Amdocs, Bell Canada Intellectual Property.  All rights reserved.
