# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-search-data/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data
  namespace: onap
data:
  analysis-config.json: "[{\n\t\t\"name\": \"whitespace_analyzer\",\n\t\t\"description\":
    \"A standard whitespace analyzer.\",\n\t\t\"behaviours\": [\n\t\t\t\"Tokenize the
    text using white space characters as delimeters.\",\n\t\t\t\"Convert all characters
    to lower case.\",\n\t\t\t\"Convert all alphanumeric and symbolic Unicode characters
    above the first 127 ASCII characters into their ASCII equivalents.\"\n\t\t],\n\t\t\"tokenizer\":
    \"whitespace\",\n\t\t\"filters\": [\n\t\t\t\"lowercase\",\n\t\t\t\"asciifolding\"\n\t\t]\n\t},\n\t{\n\t\t\"name\":
    \"ngram_analyzer\",\n\t\t\"description\": \"An analyzer which performs ngram filtering
    on the data stream.\",\n\t\t\"behaviours\": [\n\t\t\t\"Tokenize the text using white
    space characters as delimeters.\",\n\t\t\t\"Convert all characters to lower case.\",\n\t\t\t\"Convert
    all alphanumeric and symbolic Unicode characters above the first 127 ASCII characters
    into their ASCII equivalents.\",\n\t\t\t\"Apply ngram filtering using the following
    values for minimum and maximum size in codepoints of a single n-gram: minimum =
    1, maximum = 2.\"\n\t\t],\n\t\t\"tokenizer\": \"whitespace\",\n\t\t\"filters\":
    [\n\t\t\t\"lowercase\",\n\t\t\t\"asciifolding\",\n\t\t\t\"ngram_filter\"\n\t\t]\n\t}\n]"
  dynamic-custom-template.json: |-
    "dynamic_templates": [{
        "strings": {
            "match_mapping_type": "string",
            "match": "*",
            "mapping": {
                "type": "text",
                "fielddata": true
            }
        }
    }],
  elastic-search.properties: |
    # ElasticSearch Configuration
  
    es.cluster-name=POMBA_ES
    es.ip-address=pomba-es.onap
    es.http-port=9200
  es-payload-translation.json: "{\n  \"attr-translations\": [       \n    {\n      \"query\":
    \"$..[?(@.type=='string' && @.index=='analyzed')]\",\n      \"update\": {\"type\":
    \"text\", \"index\": true, \"fielddata\": true}\n    },\n    {\n      \"query\":
    \"$..[?(@.type=='string' && @.index=='not_analyzed')]\",\n      \"update\": {\"type\":
    \"keyword\", \"index\": true}\n    },\n    {\n      \"query\": \"$..[?(@.type=='string'
    && !@.index)]\",\n      \"update\": {\"type\": \"text\", \"fielddata\": true}\n
    \   }\n  ]\n}"
  filter-config.json: "[{\n\t\"name\": \"ngram_filter\",\n\t\"description\": \"Custom
    NGram Filter.\",\n\t\"configuration\": \" \\\"type\\\": \\\"nGram\\\", \\\"min_gram\\\":
    1, \\\"max_gram\\\": 50, \\\"token_chars\\\": [ \\\"letter\\\", \\\"digit\\\", \\\"punctuation\\\",
    \\\"symbol\\\" ]\"\n}]"
---
# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-search-data/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-log
  namespace: onap
data:
  logback.xml: |
    <configuration scan="true" scanPeriod="3 seconds" debug="false">
            <!--<jmxConfigurator /> -->
            <!-- directory path for all other type logs -->
  
            <property name="logDir" value="/var/log/onap" />
  
  
            <!--  specify the component name
                           <ECOMP-component-name>::= "MSO" | "DCAE" | "ASDC " | "AAI" |"Policy" | "SDNC" | "AC"  -->
            <property name="componentName" value="AAI-SDB"></property>
  
            <!--  default eelf log file names -->
            <property name="generalLogName" value="error" />
            <property name="metricsLogName" value="metrics" />
            <property name="auditLogName" value="audit" />
            <property name="debugLogName" value="debug" />
  
            <property name="errorLogPattern" value="%d{yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX}|%mdc{RequestId}|%thread|SearchDataService|%mdc{PartnerName}|%logger||%.-5level|%msg%n" />
            <property name="auditMetricPattern" value="%m%n" />
  
            <property name="logDirectory" value="${logDir}/${componentName}" />
  
            <!-- Example evaluator filter applied against console appender -->
            <appender name="STDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
                    <encoder>
                            <pattern>${errorLogPattern}</pattern>
                    </encoder>
            </appender>
  
            <!-- ============================================================================ -->
            <!-- EELF Appenders -->
            <!-- ============================================================================ -->
  
            <!-- The EELFAppender is used to record events to the general application
                          log -->
  
            <appender name="EELF" class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender">
                    <file>${logDirectory}/${generalLogName}.log</file>
                    <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy">
                            <fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${generalLogName}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log.zip
                            </fileNamePattern>
                            <maxHistory>60</maxHistory>
                    </rollingPolicy>
                    <encoder>
                            <pattern>${errorLogPattern}</pattern>
                    </encoder>
            </appender>
            <appender name="asyncEELF" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
                    <!-- deny all events with a level below INFO, that is TRACE and DEBUG -->
                    <filter class="ch.qos.logback.classic.filter.ThresholdFilter">
                            <level>INFO</level>
                    </filter>
                    <queueSize>256</queueSize>
                    <appender-ref ref="EELF" />
            </appender>
  
  
            <!-- EELF Audit Appender. This appender is used to record audit engine
                          related logging events. The audit logger and appender are specializations
             of the EELF application root logger and appender. This can be used to segregate
             Policy engine events from other components, or it can be eliminated to record
             these events as part of the application root log. -->
  
            <appender name="EELFAudit" class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender">
                    <file>${logDirectory}/${auditLogName}.log</file>
                    <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy">
                            <fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${auditLogName}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log.zip
                            </fileNamePattern>
                            <maxHistory>60</maxHistory>
                    </rollingPolicy>
                    <encoder>
                            <pattern>${auditMetricPattern}</pattern>
                    </encoder>
            </appender>
            <appender name="asyncEELFAudit" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
                    <queueSize>256</queueSize>
                    <appender-ref ref="EELFAudit" />
            </appender>
  
            <appender name="EELFMetrics" class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender">
                    <file>${logDirectory}/${metricsLogName}.log</file>
                    <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy">
                            <fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${metricsLogName}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log.zip
                            </fileNamePattern>
                            <maxHistory>60</maxHistory>
                    </rollingPolicy>
                    <encoder>
                            <!-- <pattern>"%d{HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%thread] %-5level %logger{1024} -
                                                  %msg%n"</pattern> -->
                            <pattern>${auditMetricPattern}</pattern>
                    </encoder>
            </appender>
  
  
            <appender name="asyncEELFMetrics" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
                    <queueSize>256</queueSize>
                    <appender-ref ref="EELFMetrics"/>
            </appender>
  
            <appender name="EELFDebug" class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender">
                    <file>${logDirectory}/${debugLogName}.log</file>
                    <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy">
                            <fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${debugLogName}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log.zip
                            </fileNamePattern>
                            <maxHistory>60</maxHistory>
                    </rollingPolicy>
                    <encoder>
                            <pattern>${errorLogPattern}</pattern>
                    </encoder>
            </appender>
  
            <appender name="asyncEELFDebug" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender">
                    <queueSize>256</queueSize>
                    <appender-ref ref="EELFDebug" />
                    <includeCallerData>false</includeCallerData>
            </appender>
  
  
            <!-- ============================================================================ -->
            <!--  EELF loggers -->
            <!-- ============================================================================ -->
            <logger name="com.att.eelf" level="info" additivity="false">
                    <appender-ref ref="asyncEELF" />
                    <appender-ref ref="asyncEELFDebug" />
            </logger>
  
            <logger name="com.att.eelf.audit" level="info" additivity="false">
                    <appender-ref ref="asyncEELFAudit" />
            </logger>
            <logger name="com.att.eelf.metrics" level="info" additivity="false">
                    <appender-ref ref="asyncEELFMetrics" />
            </logger>
  
            <!-- Spring related loggers -->
            <logger name="org.springframework" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.springframework.beans" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.springframework.web" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="com.blog.spring.jms" level="WARN" />
  
            <!-- SearchDB loggers -->
            <logger name="org.openecomp.sa" level="INFO" />
  
            <!-- Other Loggers that may help troubleshoot -->
            <logger name="net.sf" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.commons.httpclient" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.commons" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.coyote" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.jasper" level="WARN" />
  
            <!-- Camel Related Loggers (including restlet/servlet/jaxrs/cxf logging.
                          May aid in troubleshooting) -->
            <logger name="org.apache.camel" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.cxf" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.camel.processor.interceptor" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.cxf.jaxrs.interceptor" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.cxf.service" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.restlet" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="org.apache.camel.component.restlet" level="WARN" />
  
            <!-- logback internals logging -->
            <logger name="ch.qos.logback.classic" level="WARN" />
            <logger name="ch.qos.logback.core" level="WARN" />
  
            <root>
                    <appender-ref ref="asyncEELF" />
                    <!-- <appender-ref ref="asyncEELFDebug" /> -->
            </root>
  
    </configuration>
---

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-log
  namespace: onap
data:
  logback.xml: |-
    <configuration>
        <property name="p_tim" value="%d{&quot;yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX&quot;, UTC}"/>
        <property name="p_lvl" value="%level"/>
        <property name="p_log" value="%logger"/>
        <property name="p_mdc" value="%replace(%replace(%mdc){'\t','\\\\t'}){'\n', '\\\\n'}"/>
        <property name="p_msg" value="%replace(%replace(%msg){'\t', '\\\\t'}){'\n','\\\\n'}"/>
        <property name="p_exc" value="%replace(%replace(%rootException){'\t', '\\\\t'}){'\n','\\\\n'}"/>
        <!-- tabs -->
        <property name="p_mak" value="%replace(%replace(%marker){'\t', '\\\\t'}){'\n','\\\\n'}"/>
        <property name="p_thr" value="%thread"/>
        <property name="pattern" value="%nopexception${p_tim}\t${p_thr}\t${p_lvl}\t${p_log}\t${p_mdc}\t${p_msg}\t${p_exc}\t${p_mak}\t%n"/>
        <appender name="STDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
            <encoder>
                <pattern>${pattern}</pattern>
            </encoder>
        </appender>
        <appender name="FILE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.FileAppender">
            <file>logs/EELF/output.log</file>
            <encoder>
                <pattern>${pattern}</pattern>
            </encoder>
        </appender>
        <logger level="INFO" name="org.onap.logging.ref.slf4j" additivity="false">
            <appender-ref ref="STDOUT" />
            <appender-ref ref="FILE" />
        </logger>
        <root level="INFO">
            <appender-ref ref="STDOUT" />
            <appender-ref ref="FILE" />
        </root>
    </configuration>
---

  application.properties: |+

    # You may obtain a copy of the License at

    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License
  
    spring.jersey.type=filter
    spring.mvc.urls=swagger,docs,prometheus,auditevents,info,heapdump,autoconfig,beans,loggers,dump,env,trace,health,configprops,mappings,metrics,webjars
  
  
    server.contextPath=/service-decomposition
    spring.autoconfigure.exclude=org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.jdbc.DataSourceAutoConfiguration,org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.orm.jpa.HibernateJpaAutoConfiguration
  
    #This property is used to set the Tomcat connector attributes.developers can define multiple attributes separated by comma
    #tomcat.connector.attributes=allowTrace-true
    #The max number of active threads in this pool
    server.tomcat.max-threads=200
    #The minimum number of threads always kept alive
    server.tomcat.min-Spare-Threads=25
    #The number of milliseconds before an idle thread shutsdown, unless the number of active threads are less or equal to minSpareThreads
    server.tomcat.max-idle-time=60000
  
    basicAuth.username=admin
    basicAuth.password=OBF:1u2a1toa1w8v1tok1u30
  
    # AAI REST Client Configuration
    aai.serviceName=aai.onap
    aai.servicePort=8443
    # AAI APIs authentication mode. Valid values: [basic_auth, client_cert]
    aai.authentication=basic_auth
    aai.trustStorePath=n/a
    aai.keyStorePath=n/a
    aai.keyStorePassword=n/a
    aai.username=AAI
    aai.password=OBF:1gfr1ev31gg7
    aai.httpProtocol=https
    aai.securityProtocol=TLS
    aai.connectionTimeout=60000
    aai.readTimeout=60000
    aai.resourceList=vnfc,vserver,l3-network,pserver
    aai.serviceInstancePath=/aai/v13/nodes/service-instance/{0}
    aai.urlDepth=2
  
    #Servlet context parameters
    server.context_parameters.p-name=value #context parameter with p-name as key and value as value.

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-root-config
  namespace: onap
data:
  application.properties: |
    # ============LICENSE_START===================================================
    # Copyright (c) 2018 Amdocs
    # ============================================================================
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #    http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
    # ============LICENSE_END=====================================================
  
    # Note that the start.sh script sets the following System Properties
    # We provide default values here for testing purposes
    APP_HOME=.
    CONFIG_HOME=appconfig
    com.att.eelf.logging.path=src/main/resources
    com.att.eelf.logging.file=logback.xml
    logback.configurationFile=${com.att.eelf.logging.path}/${com.att.eelf.logging.file}
  
    schemaIngestPropLoc=${CONFIG_HOME}/schemaIngest.properties
  
    server.port=9501
    server.ssl.client-auth=want
    server.ssl.key-store=${CONFIG_HOME}/auth/tomcat_keystore
    # Work-around for missing Java certificates file "cacerts". This default value should be overridden.
    server.ssl.trust-store=${CONFIG_HOME}/auth/tomcat_keystore
  
    server.tomcat.max-threads=200
    # The minimum number of threads always kept alive
    server.tomcat.min-spare-threads=25
  
    # Spring Boot logging
    logging.config=${logback.configurationFile}
  
    consumer.topic.names=poa-rule-validation
    publisher.topic.names=poa-audit-result
  
    topics.properties.location=${CONFIG_HOME}/topics/
---
# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-validation-service/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-config-properties
  namespace: onap
data:
  README.txt: |
    This directory contains all external configuration files that
    need to be mounted into an application container.
  
    See the configmap.yaml in the templates directory for an example
    of how to load (ie map) config files from this directory, into
    Kubernetes, for distribution within the k8s cluster.
  
    See deployment.yaml in the templates directory for an example
    of how the 'config mapped' files are then mounted into the
    containers.
  aai-environment.properties: |
    host=dummy-host.onap.org
    port=8443
    httpProtocol=https
    trustStorePath=/auth/tomcat_keystore
    #trustStorePassword intentionally left blank
    trustStorePassword.x=
    keyStorePath=/auth/client-cert-onap.p12
    keyStorePassword.x=dfcfd1003bdde18de8efea3c8661510e
    keyManagerFactoryAlgorithm=SunX509
    keyStoreType=PKCS12
    securityProtocol=TLS
    connectionTimeout=5000
    readTimeout=1000
  
    baseModelURI=/aai/v8/service-design-and-creation/models/model
  auth_policy.json: |
    {"roles": [
        {
            "name": "admin",
            "functions": [
                {
                    "name": "actions",
                    "methods": [
                        {"name": "GET"},
                        {"name": "DELETE"},
                        {"name": "PUT"}
                    ]

                {"username": "CN=test, OU=qa, O=Test Ltd, L=London, ST=London, C=GB"},
                {"username": "CN=aai-client.dev.att.com, OU=aai digicert client dev, O=\"AT&T Services, Inc.\", L=Dallas, ST=Texas, C=US"}
            ]

            "name": "ops",
            "functions": [{
                "name": "actions",
                "methods": [{"name": "POST"}]
            }],
            "users": [
                {"username": "CN=common-name, OU=org-unit, O=org, L=location, ST=state, C=US"},
                {"username": "CN=test, OU=qa, O=Test Ltd, L=London, ST=London, C=GB"}
            ]
        },

            "name": "basicauth",

                "user": "aai",
                "pass": "OBF:1u2a1t2v1vgb1s3g1s3m1vgj1t3b1u30"
            }]
        }
    ]}
  rule-data-dictionary.properties: |
    rule.datadictionary.hostport=http://dummy-host:443
    rule.datadictionary.connect.timeout=1000
    rule.datadictionary.read.timeout=1000
  
    # basic authentication: base64 encoding of username:password
    rule.datadictionary.credentials=cG9tYmE6cG9tYmE=
  
    # ex: /commonModelElements/instance~nfValuesCatalog~1.0/
    rule.datadictionary.uri=/commonModelElements/{0}~{1}~1.0/validateInstance
  rule-indexing.properties: |
    rule.indexing.events=POA-EVENT
    rule.indexing.exclude.oxm.validation=POA-EVENT
    rule.indexing.key.attributes=$.poa-event.modelVersionId,$.poa-event.modelInvariantId
    rule.indexing.default.key=default-rules
  schemaIngest.properties: |
    # Properties for the SchemaLocationsBean
    # The AAI Schema jar will be unpacked to bundleconfig/etc
    schemaConfig=bundleconfig
    # Files named aai_oxm_v*.xml are unpacked here:
    nodeDir=${APP_HOME}/bundleconfig/etc/oxm
    # Dummy folder/directory:
    edgeDir=${APP_HOME}/bundleconfig/etc/oxm
  validation-service-auth.properties: |
    auth.policy.file=${CONFIG_HOME}/auth_policy.json
    auth.authentication.disable=false
  validation-service.properties: |
    topic.publish.enable=true
    topic.publish.retries=3
    topic.consume.enable=true
    topic.consume.polling.interval.seconds=3
  
    event.domain=onap
    event.action.exclude=DELETE
    event.type.rule=POA-EVENT
    event.type.model=NOT-APPLICABLE-IN-POMBA
    event.type.end=END-EVENT
  
    model.cache.expirySeconds=3
    aai.oxm.version=10

# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-validation-service/templates/configmap.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-rules
  namespace: onap
data:
  default-rules.groovy: "/*\n * ============LICENSE_START===================================================\n
    * Copyright (c) 2018 Amdocs\n * ============================================================================\n
    * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n * you may
    not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n * You may obtain a copy
    of the License at\n *\n *        http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n *\n
    * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n * distributed
    under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR
    CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n * See the License for the specific
    language governing permissions and\n * limitations under the License.\n * ============LICENSE_END=====================================================\n
    */\n\nentity {\n    name 'POA-EVENT'\n    indexing {\n        indices 'default-rules'\n
    \   }\n  validation {\n\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison: Context level\n    useRule
    {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.ndcb', 'context-list.aai'\n
    \   }\n\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison: Service entity\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.ndcb.service', 'context-list.aai.service'\n    }\n\n
    \   // NDCB-AAI comparison: Context level network list\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.ndcb.networkList[*]', 'context-list.aai.networkList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\t\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison: VNF list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison: VNF network list\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].networkList[*]',
    'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].networkList[*]'\n    }\n\t\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison:
    VF-Module list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes
    'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison: VF-Module network list\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].networkList[*]',
    'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].networkList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // NDCB-AAI
    comparison: VNFC list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes
    'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison: VM list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].vmList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].vmList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // NDCB-AAI comparison: P-Interface list\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.ndcb.pnfList[*].pInterfaceList[*]',
    'context-list.aai.pnfList[*].pInterfaceList[*]'\n    }\n\t\n\t\n    // SDNC-AAI
    comparison: Context level\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes
    'context-list.sdnc', 'context-list.aai'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI comparison: Service
    entity\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.service',
    'context-list.aai.service'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI comparison: Context level network
    list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.networkList[*]',
    'context-list.aai.networkList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI comparison: VNF list\n
    \   useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*]',
    'context-list.aai.vnfList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI comparison: VNF network
    list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].networkList[*]',
    'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].networkList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI comparison:
    VF-Module list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes
    'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI comparison: VF-Module network list\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].networkList[*]',
    'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].networkList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI
    comparison: VNFC list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes
    'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDNC-AAI comparison: VM list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].vmList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].vmList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // AAI-SDNC PNF name validation\n    useRule {\n      name 'AAI-SDNC-pnf-name-check'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.aai.pnfList[*].name', 'context-list.sdnc.pnfList[*].name'\n
    \   }\n\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison: Context level\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc', 'context-list.ndcb'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison: Service entity\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.service', 'context-list.ndcb.service'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison: Context level network list\n    useRule {\n
    \     name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.networkList[*]',
    'context-list.ndcb.networkList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison: VNF list\n
    \   useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*]',
    'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison: VNF network
    list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].networkList[*]',
    'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].networkList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison:
    VF-Module list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes
    'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]', 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison: VF-Module network list\n    useRule {\n      name
    'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].networkList[*]',
    'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].networkList[*]'\n    }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB
    comparison: VNFC list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n      attributes
    'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]', 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDNC-NDCB comparison: VM list\n    useRule {\n      name 'Attribute-comparison'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.sdnc.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].vmList[*]', 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].vmList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n\t\n\t\n    // SDC-AAI VNFC type\n    useRule {\n      name 'SDC-AAI-vnfc-type'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.sdc.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDC-AAI VNFC node count\n    useRule {\n      name 'SDC-AAI-vnfc-node-count'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.sdc.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vnfcList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    // SDC-AAI VF-Module instance\n    useRule {\n      name 'SDC-AAI-vf-module-instance-check'\n
    \     attributes 'context-list.sdc.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]', 'context-list.aai.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*]'\n
    \   }\n\n    useRule {\n       name 'AAI-not-empty'\n       attributes 'context-list.aai.pnfList',
    'context-list.aai.vnfList', 'context-list.aai.networkList'\n    }\n  }\n}\n\nrule
    {\n    name        'AAI-not-empty'\n    category    'VNFC Consistency'\n    description
    'Check if AAI collected anything'\n    errorText   'AAI section is empty'\n    severity
    \   'ERROR'\n    attributes  'pnfList', 'vnfList', 'networkList'\n    validate    '''\n
    \       // expect at least one not empty list\n        return !pnfList.isEmpty()
    || !vnfList.isEmpty() || !networkList.isEmpty()\n                '''\n}\n\nrule
    {\n  name        'SDC-AAI-vnfc-type'\n  category    'VNFC Consistency'\n  description
    'Validate that each VNFC instance in AAI conforms to a VNFC type defined in SDC
    model'\n  errorText   'AAI VNFC instance includes non-specified type in design SDC
    model'\n  severity    'ERROR'\n  attributes  'sdcList', 'aaiList'\n  validate    '''\n
    \       def getVnfcTypes = { parsedData ->\n          parsedData.collect{ it.findResult{
    k, v -> if(k.equals(\"type\")) {return \"$v\"}}}\n        }\n\n        def slurper
    = new groovy.json.JsonSlurper()\n        def sdcTypes = getVnfcTypes(slurper.parseText(sdcList.toString()))\n
    \       def aaiTypes = getVnfcTypes(slurper.parseText(aaiList.toString()))\n\n        //
    each type in AAI must exist in SDC\n        return sdcTypes.containsAll(aaiTypes)\n
    \               '''\n}\n\nrule {\n  name        'SDC-AAI-vnfc-node-count'\n  category
    \   'VNFC Consistency'\n  description 'Validate that for each VNFC node defined
    in SDC model, there is at least one VNFC instance in AAI'\n  errorText   'Design
    has specified types but not all of them exist in AAI'\n  severity    'WARNING'\n
    \ attributes  'sdcList', 'aaiList'\n  validate    '''\n        def getVnfcNodes
    = { parsedData ->\n          parsedData.collect { new Tuple2(\n              it.findResult{
    k, v -> if(k.equals(\"name\")) {return \"$v\"}},\n              it.findResult{ k,
    v -> if(k.equals(\"type\")) {return \"$v\"}})\n          }\n        }\n\n        def
    slurper = new groovy.json.JsonSlurper()\n        def sdcNodes = getVnfcNodes(slurper.parseText(sdcList.toString()))\n
    \       def aaiNodes = getVnfcNodes(slurper.parseText(aaiList.toString()))\n\n        //
    each node in AAI must exist in SDC\n        return aaiNodes.containsAll(sdcNodes)\n
    \               '''\n}\n\nrule {\n  name        'SDC-AAI-vf-module-instance-check'\n
    \ category    'VF Consistency'\n  description 'Validate that each VF module instance
    in AAI conforms to a VF module defined in SDC service model'\n  errorText   'One
    or more AAI VF module instance(s) not defined in SDC model'\n  severity    'CRITICAL'\n
    \ attributes  'sdcList', 'aaiList'\n  validate    '''\n        def getVfModules
    = { parsedData ->\n          parsedData.collect{ it.findResult{ k, v -> if(k.equals(\"name\"))
    {return \"$v\"}}}\n        }\n\n        def slurper = new groovy.json.JsonSlurper()\n
    \       def sdcVfModules = getVfModules(slurper.parseText(sdcList.toString()))\n
    \       def aaiVfModules = getVfModules(slurper.parseText(aaiList.toString()))\n\n
    \       // all VF modules in AAI must exist in SDC\n        return aaiVfModules.containsAll(sdcVfModules)\n
    \               '''\n}\n\nrule {\n  name        'Attribute-comparison'\n  category
    \   'Attribute Mismatch'\n  description 'Determine all discrepancies between values
    for attributes with matching names from each model'\n  errorText   'Error found
    with attribute(s) and values: {0}'\n  severity    'ERROR'\n  attributes  'lhsObject',
    'rhsObject'\n  validate    '''\n\t\t// This closure extracts the given object's
    root level attributes and contents of the attribute list.\n\t\t// Complex items
    like lists are excluded.\n\t\t// Returns a map containing attribute names as keys,
    mapping to a list of values for each attribute.\n\t\tClosure<java.util.Map> getAttributes
    = { parsedData ->\n\t\t\tjava.util.Map attributeMap = new java.util.HashMap()\n\n\t\t\tdef
    isAttributeDataQualityOk = { attribute ->\n\t\t\t\tattribute.findResult{ k, v ->
    if(k.equals(\"dataQuality\") ) {return v.get(\"status\")}}.equals(\"ok\")\n\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\tdef
    addToMap = { attrKey, attrValue ->\n\t\t\t\tjava.util.Set values = attributeMap.get(\"$attrKey\")\n\t\t\t\tif(values
    == null) {\n\t\t\t\t\tvalues = new java.util.HashSet()\n\t\t\t\t\tattributeMap.put(\"$attrKey\",
    values)\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\tvalues.add(\"$attrValue\")\n\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\tdef addAttributeToMap
    = { attribute ->\n\t\t\t\tif(isAttributeDataQualityOk(attribute)) {\n\t\t\t\t\tString
    key, value\n\t\t\t\t\tattribute.each { k, v ->\n\t\t\t\t\t\tif(k.equals(\"name\"))
    {key = \"$v\"}\n\t\t\t\t\t\tif(k.equals(\"value\")) {value = \"$v\"}\n\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t\taddToMap(\"$key\",
    \"$value\")\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\tdef processKeyValue = { key, value ->\n\t\t\t\tif(value
    instanceof java.util.ArrayList) {\n\t\t\t\t\tif(key.equals(\"attributeList\")) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\tvalue.each
    {\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\taddAttributeToMap(it)\n\t\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t} else
    if(!(value instanceof groovy.json.internal.LazyMap)) {\n\t\t\t\t\t// only add key-value
    attributes, skip the rest\n\t\t\t\t\taddToMap(\"$key\", \"$value\")\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\tif(parsedData
    instanceof java.util.ArrayList) {\n\t\t\t\tparsedData.each {\n\t\t\t\t\tit.each
    { key, value -> processKeyValue(key, value) }\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t} else {\n\t\t\t\tparsedData.each
    { key, value -> processKeyValue(key, value) }\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t\treturn attributeMap\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t//
    This closure compares all values for each key from the left map, to values of the
    same key from the right map.\n\t\t// Returns a map of attributes with mismatched
    or missing values (i.e. attribute name mapped to list of failed values).\n\t\tClosure<java.util.Map>
    compareAttributes = { java.util.Map left, java.util.Map right ->\n\t\t\tjava.util.Map
    violationMap = new java.util.HashMap()\n\t\t\tleft.each{ leftKey, leftValueList
    ->\n\t\t\t\tdef rightValueList = right.get(\"$leftKey\")\n\t\t\t\trightValueList.each{
    rightValue ->\n\t\t\t\t\tif(!leftValueList.any{ it == \"$rightValue\" }) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\tdef
    existingValues = violationMap.get(leftKey)\n\t\t\t\t\t\tif(existingValues) {\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\texistingValues.add(\"$rightValue\")\n\t\t\t\t\t\t}
    else {\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tjava.util.Set newValues = new HashSet()\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tnewValues.add(\"$rightValue\")\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tviolationMap.put(\"$leftKey\",
    newValues)\n\t\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t\treturn violationMap\n\t\t}\n\n\t\t//
    This closure merges the given maps into a new map.\n\t\t// Returns a map containing
    all keys and their values from both maps.\n\t\tClosure<java.util.Map> mergeMaps
    = { java.util.Map left, java.util.Map right ->\n\t\t\tif(left.isEmpty() && right.isEmpty())
    {\n\t\t\t\treturn [:]\n\t\t\t} else if(left.isEmpty()) {\n\t\t\t\treturn right\n\t\t\t}
    else if(right.isEmpty()) {\n\t\t\t\treturn left\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t\tjava.util.Map merged
    = new java.util.HashMap()\n\t\t\tmerged.putAll(left)\n\t\t\tright.each{ rightKey,
    rightValues ->\n\t\t\t\tjava.util.Set mergedValues = merged.get(rightKey)\n\t\t\t\tif(mergedValues
    == null) {\n\t\t\t\t\tmerged.put(rightKey, rightValues)\n\t\t\t\t} else {\n\t\t\t\t\tmergedValues.addAll(rightValues)\n\t\t\t\t}\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t\treturn
    merged\n\t\t}\n\n\t\tdef slurper = new groovy.json.JsonSlurper()\n\t\tjava.util.Map
    lhsAttributes = getAttributes(slurper.parseText(lhsObject.toString()))\n\t\tjava.util.Map
    rhsAttributes = getAttributes(slurper.parseText(rhsObject.toString()))\n\n\t\tdef
    leftToRight = compareAttributes(lhsAttributes, rhsAttributes)\n\t\tdef rightToLeft
    = compareAttributes(rhsAttributes, lhsAttributes)\n\t\tdef mergedResults = mergeMaps(leftToRight,
    rightToLeft)\n\n\t\tboolean success = true\n\t\tList<String> details = new ArrayList<>()\n\t\tif(!mergedResults.isEmpty())
    {\n\t\t\tsuccess = false\n\t\t\tdetails.add(mergedResults.toString())\n\t\t}\n\t\treturn
    new Tuple2(success, details)\n        '''\n}\n\n/*\n * The data-dictionary rule
    below can be used with this useRule clause:\n *   useRule {\n *     name 'Data-Dictionary
    validate VF type'\n *     attributes 'context-list.ndcb.vnfList[*].vfModuleList[*].networkList[*].type'\n
    *   }\n */\nrule {\n    name        'Data-Dictionary validate VF type'\n    category
    \   'INVALID_VALUE'\n    description 'Validate all VF type values against data-dictionary'\n
    \   errorText   'VF type [{0}] failed data-dictionary validation: {1}'\n    severity
    \   'ERROR'\n    attributes  'typeList'\n    validate    '''\n        boolean success
    = true\n        List<String> details = new ArrayList<>()\n        typeList.any {\n
    \           if(!success) {\n                // break out of 'any' loop\n                return
    false\n            }\n            def result = org.onap.aai.validation.ruledriven.rule.builtin.DataDictionary.validate(\"instance\",
    \"vfModuleNetworkType\", \"type\", \"$it\")\n            if(!result.isEmpty()) {\n
    \               success = false\n                details.add(\"$it\")\n                details.add(\"$result\")\n
    \           }\n        }\n        return new Tuple2(success, details)\n        '''\n}\n\nrule
    {\n  name        'AAI-SDNC-pnf-name-check'\n  category    'PNF Consistency'\n  description
    'Validate that each PNF name in AAI matches a PNF name in the SDNC model'\n  errorText
    \  'AAI PNF names do not match SDNC - {0}'\n  severity    'ERROR'\n  attributes
    \ 'aaiNames', 'sdncNames'\n  validate    '''\n        def addName = { values, key
    ->\n                values.add(\"$key\")\n        }\n\n        List<String> errorReasons
    = new ArrayList();\n\n        if (aaiNames.size() != sdncNames.size()) {\n            errorReasons.add(\"Number
    of PNFs don't match; aai has ${aaiNames.size()}, sdnc has ${sdncNames.size()}\")\n
    \           return new Tuple2(false, errorReasons)\n        }\n\n        // collect
    all the \"name\" values from AAI and SDNC into two Sets.\n        Set aaiNameSet
    = new java.util.HashSet()\n        aaiNames.each {\n           aValue -> addName(aaiNameSet,
    aValue)\n        }\n\n        Set sdncNameSet = new java.util.HashSet()\n        sdncNames.each
    {\n            aValue -> addName(sdncNameSet, aValue)\n        }\n\n        // Validate
    that the names match by comparing the size of the two Sets.\n        if (aaiNameSet.size()
    != sdncNameSet.size()) {\n            errorReasons.add(\"Number of distinct PNF
    names don't match; aai: ${aaiNameSet}, sdnc: ${sdncNameSet}\")\n            return
    new Tuple2(false, errorReasons)\n        }\n\n        Set combinedSet = new HashSet();\n
    \       combinedSet.addAll(aaiNameSet);\n        combinedSet.addAll(sdncNameSet);\n
    \       if (combinedSet.size() != aaiNameSet.size()) {\n            errorReasons.add(\"PNF
    names don't match; aai names: ${aaiNameSet}, sdnc names: ${sdncNameSet}\")\n            return
    new Tuple2(false, errorReasons)\n        }\n\n        return true\n\n        '''\n}\n"
---
# Source: pomba/templates/configmap.yaml
# Copyright  2018 Amdocs
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
  namespace: onap
data:
  filebeat.yml: |
    filebeat.prospectors:
    #it is mandatory, in our case it's log
    - input_type: log
      #This is the canolical path as mentioned in logback.xml, *.* means it will monitor all files in the directory.
      paths:
        - /opt/app/logs/EELF/*/*.log
        - /opt/app/logs/EELF/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*/*/*/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*/*/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*.log
        - /logs/*/*.log
        - /logs/*.log
  
      #Files older than this should be ignored.In our case it will be 48 hours i.e. 2 days. It is a helping flag for clean_inactive
      ignore_older: 48h
      # Remove the registry entry for a file that is more than the specified time. In our case it will be 96 hours, i.e. 4 days. It will help to keep registry records with in limit
      clean_inactive: 96h
  
  
    # Name of the registry file. If a relative path is used, it is considered relative to the
    # data path. Else full qualified file name.
    #filebeat.registry_file: ${path.data}/registry
  
  
    output.logstash:
      #List of logstash server ip addresses with port number.
      #But, in our case, this will be the loadbalancer IP address.
      #For the below property to work the loadbalancer or logstash should expose 5044 port to listen the filebeat events or port in the property should be changed appropriately.
      hosts: ["log-ls.onap:5044"]
      #If enable will do load balancing among availabe Logstash, automatically.
      loadbalance: true
  
      #The list of root certificates for server verifications.
      #If certificate_authorities is empty or not set, the trusted
      #certificate authorities of the host system are used.
      #ssl.certificate_authorities: $ssl.certificate_authorities
  
      #The path to the certificate for SSL client authentication. If the certificate is not specified,
      #client authentication is not available.
      #ssl.certificate: $ssl.certificate
  
      #The client certificate key used for client authentication.
      #ssl.key: $ssl.key
  
      #The passphrase used to decrypt an encrypted key stored in the configured key file
      #ssl.key_passphrase: $ssl.key_passphrase
---
# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-data-router/templates/pv.yaml
kind: PersistentVolume
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-data-router
    chart: "pomba-data-router-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-pomba"
    heritage: "Tiller"
    name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router
spec:
  capacity:
    storage: 2Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  hostPath:
    path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-pomba/pomba/data-router/logs
---

  name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch
  namespace: onap
  labels:

    chart: "pomba-elasticsearch-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-pomba"
    heritage: "Tiller"
    name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch
spec:
  capacity:
    storage: 1Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  hostPath:
    path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-pomba/pomba/elasticsearch/data

# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-data-router/templates/pvc.yaml
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-data-router
    chart: "pomba-data-router-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-pomba"
    heritage: "Tiller"
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 2Gi
---

# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-aaictxbuilder/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2018 Amdocs
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-aaictxbuilder
    chart: pomba-aaictxbuilder-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-aaictxbuilder
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: pomba-aaictxbuilder
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/pomba-aai-context-builder:1.5.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-log-conf
            subPath: logback.xml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-logs-eelf
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs/EELF
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/application.properties
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-config
            subPath: application.properties
            readOnly: true


          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-aaictxbuilder-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-log-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-log
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-aaictxbuilder-logs-eelf
          emptyDir: {}

      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-contextaggregator/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-contextaggregator
    chart: pomba-contextaggregator-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-contextaggregator
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - message-router
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: pomba-contextaggregator-readiness
      containers:
        - name: pomba-contextaggregator
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/pomba-context-aggregator:1.5.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 9529
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 9529
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/application.properties
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-config
            subPath: application.properties
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/builders
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-config-builders
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-log-conf
            subPath: logback.xml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-logs-eelf
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs/EELF
            readOnly: false

          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-contextaggregator-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-config-builders
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-configmap-builders
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-log-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-log
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-contextaggregator-logs-eelf
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-data-router
    chart: pomba-data-router-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: pomba-data-router
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-data-router
        release: dev-pomba
      name: pomba-data-router
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - pomba-search-data
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: pomba-data-router-readiness
      - command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        - |
          mkdir -p /logroot/data-router/logs
          chmod -R 777 /logroot/data-router/logs
          chown -R root:root /logroot
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        image: docker.io/library/busybox:latest
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: init-sysctl
        volumeMounts:
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-logs
          mountPath: /logroot/
      containers:
      - name: pomba-data-router
        image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/data-router:1.3.3"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        env:
        - name: SERVICE_BEANS
          value: /opt/app/data-router/dynamic/conf
        - name: CONFIG_HOME
          value: /opt/app/data-router/config/
        - name: KEY_STORE_PASSWORD
          value: OBF:1y0q1uvc1uum1uvg1pil1pjl1uuq1uvk1uuu1y10
        - name: DYNAMIC_ROUTES
          value: /opt/app/data-router/dynamic/routes
        - name: KEY_MANAGER_PASSWORD
          value: OBF:1y0q1uvc1uum1uvg1pil1pjl1uuq1uvk1uuu1y10
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/localtime
          name: localtime
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath:  /opt/app/data-router/config/auth
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-auth
        - mountPath:  /opt/app/data-router/config/data-router.properties
          subPath: data-router.properties
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-properties
        - mountPath:  /opt/app/data-router/config/schemaIngest.properties
          subPath: schemaIngest.properties
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-properties
        - mountPath: /opt/app/data-router/dynamic/routes/audit.route
          subPath: audit.route
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic-route
        - mountPath: /opt/app/data-router/dynamic/routes/poaValidation.route
          subPath: poaValidation.route
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic-route
        - mountPath: /opt/app/data-router/dynamic/conf/audit-bean.xml
          subPath: audit-bean.xml
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic-policy
        - mountPath: /opt/app/data-router/dynamic/conf/poa-validation-bean.xml
          subPath: poa-validation-bean.xml
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic-policy
        - mountPath: /logs/
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-logs
        resources:
                      {}
                      
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9502
        livenessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 9502
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          periodSeconds: 30
        readinessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 9502
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          periodSeconds: 30

      # Filebeat sidecar container
      - name: pomba-data-router-filebeat-onap
        image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        volumeMounts:
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-filebeat-conf
          mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
          subPath: filebeat.yml
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-data-filebeat
          mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-logs
          mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
      - name: localtime
        hostPath:
          path: /etc/localtime
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-auth
        secret:
          secretName: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-properties
        configMap:
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-prop
          items:
          - key: data-router.properties
            path: data-router.properties
          - key: schemaIngest.properties
            path: schemaIngest.properties
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-filebeat-conf
        configMap:
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-data-filebeat
        emptyDir: {}
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic-route
        configMap:
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic-policy
        configMap:
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-dynamic
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router-logs
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: dev-pomba-pomba-data-router
      restartPolicy: Always
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-elasticsearch/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-elasticsearch
    chart: pomba-elasticsearch-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-elasticsearch
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        - |
          sysctl -w vm.max_map_count=262144
          mkdir -p /logroot/elasticsearch/logs
          mkdir -p /logroot/elasticsearch/data
          chmod -R 777 /logroot/elasticsearch
          chown -R root:root /logroot
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        image: registry.hub.docker.com/library/busybox:latest
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: init-sysctl
        volumeMounts:
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch-logs
          mountPath: /logroot/
      containers:
        - name: pomba-elasticsearch
          image: "docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:6.6.2"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 9200
            name: pomba-es
          - containerPort: 9300
            name: pomba-es-tcp
# disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 9200
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 10
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 9300
            initialDelaySeconds: 120
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/config/elasticsearch.yml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch-config
            subPath: elasticsearch.yml
          - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data/
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch-data
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch-configmap
            items:
            - key: elasticsearch.yml
              path: elasticsearch.yml
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch-data
          persistentVolumeClaim:
            claimName: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-elasticsearch-logs
          hostPath:
            path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-pomba/pomba
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: pomba/charts/pomba-kibana/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-kibana
    chart: pomba-kibana-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-kibana
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - pomba-elasticsearch
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: pomba-kibana-readiness
      - args:
        - --output=http://pomba-es.onap:9200/.kibana
        - --input=/config/default-mapping.json
        - --type=mapping
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "docker.io/taskrabbit/elasticsearch-dump"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: pomba-kibana-config-map
        volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /config/default-mapping.json
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana
            subPath: default-mapping.json
      - args:
        - --output=http://pomba-es.onap:9200/.kibana
        - --input=/config/default.json
        - --type=data
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "docker.io/taskrabbit/elasticsearch-dump"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: pomba-kibana-config
        volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /config/default.json
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana
            subPath: default.json
      containers:
        - name: pomba-kibana
          image: "docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana:6.6.2"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          command: ["/bin/bash"]
          args: ["-c", "/opt/app/bin/kibana_start.sh"]
          ports:
          - containerPort: 5601
            name: pomba-kibana
          readinessProbe:
            httpGet:
              path: "/"
              scheme: "HTTPS"
              port: 5601
            initialDelaySeconds: 300
            periodSeconds: 10
            timeoutSeconds: 1
# disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          livenessProbe:
            httpGet:
              path: "/"
              scheme: "HTTPS"
              port: 5601
            initialDelaySeconds: 300
            periodSeconds: 10
            timeoutSeconds: 1
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /usr/share/kibana/config
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana
          - mountPath: /opt/app/auth
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana-auth
          - mountPath: /opt/app/bin
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana-bin
          resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana
            items:
            - key: kibana.yml
              path: kibana.yml
            - key: default.json
              path: default.json
            - key: default-mapping.json
              path: default-mapping.json
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana-auth
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana-auth
            defaultMode: 0777
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana-bin
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-kibana-bin
            defaultMode: 0777
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-networkdiscovery
    chart: pomba-networkdiscovery-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-networkdiscovery
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: pomba-networkdiscovery
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/network-discovery:1.5.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8443
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8443
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8443
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-log-conf
            subPath: logback.xml
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/application.properties
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-config
            subPath: application.properties
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/auth/client-cert-onap.p12
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-auth-secret
            subPath: client-cert-onap.p12
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/auth/tomcat_keystore
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-auth-secret
            subPath: tomcat_keystore
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-logs-eelf
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs/EELF
            readOnly: false

          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-networkdiscovery-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-log-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-log
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-auth-secret
          secret:
            secretName: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-auth
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscovery-logs-eelf
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder
    chart: pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/pomba-network-discovery-context-builder:1.5.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-log-conf
            subPath: logback.xml
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/application.properties
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-config
            readOnly: true
            subPath: application.properties
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-logs-eelf
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs/EELF
            readOnly: false

          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-log-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-log
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-networkdiscoveryctxbuilder-logs-eelf
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-sdcctxbuilder
    chart: pomba-sdcctxbuilder-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-sdcctxbuilder
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: pomba-sdcctxbuilder
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/pomba-sdc-context-builder:1.5.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/application.properties
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-config
            subPath: application.properties
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-log-conf
            subPath: logback.xml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-logs-eelf
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs/EELF
            readOnly: false
          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-sdcctxbuilder-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-configmap
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-log-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-log
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-sdcctxbuilder-logs-eelf
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-sdncctxbuilder
    chart: pomba-sdncctxbuilder-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-sdncctxbuilder
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: pomba-sdncctxbuilder
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/pomba-sdnc-context-builder:1.5.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 60
            periodSeconds: 30
          
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 60
            periodSeconds: 30
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-log-conf
            subPath: logback.xml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-logs-eelf
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs/EELF
            readOnly: false
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/application.properties
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-config
            subPath: application.properties
            readOnly: true
          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-sdncctxbuilder-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-log-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-log
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-sdncctxbuilder-logs-eelf
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
