apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-search-data
    chart: pomba-search-data-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: pomba-search-data
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-search-data
        release: dev-pomba
      name: pomba-search-data
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - pomba-elasticsearch
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: pomba-search-data-readiness
      containers:
      - name: pomba-search-data
        image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/search-data-service:1.3.1"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        env:
        - name: CONFIG_HOME
          value: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/
        - name: KEY_STORE_PASSWORD
          value: OBF:1y0q1uvc1uum1uvg1pil1pjl1uuq1uvk1uuu1y10
        - name: KEY_MANAGER_PASSWORD
          value: OBF:1y0q1uvc1uum1uvg1pil1pjl1uuq1uvk1uuu1y10
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/localtime
          name: localtime
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/filter-config.json
          subPath: filter-config.json
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-config
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/elastic-search.properties
          subPath: elastic-search.properties
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-config
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/analysis-config.json
          subPath: analysis-config.json
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-config
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/es-payload-translation.json
          subPath: es-payload-translation.json
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-config
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/dynamic-custom-template.json
          subPath: dynamic-custom-template.json
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-config
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/auth/tomcat_keystore
          subPath: tomcat_keystore
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-auth-config
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/config/auth/search_policy.json
          subPath: search_policy.json
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-search-policy-config
        - mountPath: /var/log/onap
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-logs
        - mountPath: /opt/app/search-data-service/bundleconfig/etc/logback.xml
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-log-conf
          subPath: logback.xml
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9509
        # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
        # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
        livenessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 9509
          initialDelaySeconds: 30
          periodSeconds: 10
        readinessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 9509
          initialDelaySeconds: 30
          periodSeconds: 10
        resources:
                      {}
                      

      # side car containers
      - name: filebeat-onap
        image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
          subPath: filebeat.yml
          name: filebeat-conf
        - mountPath: /var/log/onap
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-logs
        - mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-filebeat

      volumes:
      - name: localtime
        hostPath:
          path: /etc/localtime
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-config
        configMap:
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-auth-config
        secret:
          secretName: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-keystone
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-search-policy-config
        secret:
          secretName: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-policy
      - name: filebeat-conf
        configMap:
          name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-logs
        emptyDir: {}
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-filebeat
        emptyDir: {}
      - name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-log-conf
        configMap:
         name: dev-pomba-pomba-search-data-service-log
      restartPolicy: Always
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-servicedecomposition
    chart: pomba-servicedecomposition-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-servicedecomposition
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: pomba-servicedecomposition
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/service-decomposition:1.5.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          livenessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          
          readinessProbe:
            tcpSocket:
              port: 8080
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            periodSeconds: 10
          env:
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-logs
            mountPath: /var/log/onap
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/logback.xml
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-log-conf
            subPath: logback.xml
          - mountPath: /opt/app/config/application.properties
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-config
            subPath: application.properties
            readOnly: true

          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-servicedecomposition-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-logs
            mountPath: /var/log/onap

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-log-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-log
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-config
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-servicedecomposition-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}

      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: pomba-validation-service
    chart: pomba-validation-service-5.0.0
    release: dev-pomba
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pomba-validation-service
        release: dev-pomba
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: pomba-validation-service
          image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/validation:1.3.1"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
          - containerPort: 8080
          # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
          # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
          
          
          env:
            - name: APP_HOME
              value: "/opt/app/validation-service"
            - name: CONFIG_HOME
              value: "/opt/app/validation-service/appconfig"
            - name: MAX_HEAP
              value: "1024"
          volumeMounts:
          - mountPath: /etc/localtime
            name: localtime
            readOnly: true
          - mountPath: /opt/app/validation-service/application.properties
            name: root-config-app-prop
            subPath: application.properties
          - mountPath: /opt/app/validation-service/appconfig/
            name: properties
          - mountPath: /opt/app/validation-service/appconfig/auth/
            name: config-auth
          - mountPath: /opt/app/validation-service/appconfig/topics/
            name: config-topics
          - mountPath: /opt/app/validation-service/bundleconfig/etc/rules/poa-event/
            name: rules
          resources:
                        {}
                        

        # Filebeat sidecar container
        - name: pomba-validation-service-filebeat-onap
          image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-filebeat-conf
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
            subPath: filebeat.yml
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-data-filebeat
            mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
          - name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-logs
            mountPath: /opt/app/logs

      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-filebeat-configmap
        - name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: root-config-app-prop
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-root-config
            defaultMode: 0644
        - name:  dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-logs
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: properties
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-config-properties
            defaultMode: 0644
            items:
            - key: validation-service.properties
              path: validation-service.properties
            - key: validation-service-auth.properties
              path: validation-service-auth.properties
            - key: rule-indexing.properties
              path: rule-indexing.properties
            - key: rule-data-dictionary.properties
              path: rule-data-dictionary.properties
            - key: aai-environment.properties
              path: aai-environment.properties
            - key: schemaIngest.properties
              path: schemaIngest.properties
            - key: auth_policy.json
              path: auth_policy.json
        - name: config-auth
          secret:
            secretName: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-config-auth-secret
            items:
            - key: tomcat_keystore
              path: tomcat_keystore
            - key: client-cert-onap.p12
              path: client-cert-onap.p12
        - name: config-topics
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-config-topics
            defaultMode: 0644
            items:
            - key: topic-poa-audit-result.properties
              path: topic-poa-audit-result.properties
            - key: topic-poa-rule-validation.properties
              path: topic-poa-rule-validation.properties
        - name: rules
          configMap:
            name: dev-pomba-pomba-validation-service-rules
            defaultMode: 0644
            items:
            - key: default-rules.groovy
              path: default-rules.groovy
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
Release "dev-pomba" has been upgraded. Happy Helming!

    not found, please contact system administrator.\nlogin.error.user.inactive = Account
    is disabled, please contact system administrator.\n\n#\n# Number of seconds to poll

    a component is down a log entry will be written that triggers an alert.  This parameter
    specifies how often this alert should be triggered\n# if the component remains down.
    \  For example a value of 30, would translate to 30 * 60 seconds = 1800 seconds,
    or every 30 minutes\n#\nhealth_fail_alert_every_x_intervals =  30\n"
  logback.xml: "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\r\n<!--\r\n  ============LICENSE_START==========================================\r\n

    Commons License, Attribution 4.0 Intl. (the License);\r\n  you may not use this

    of the License at\r\n\r\n              https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/\r\n\r\n

    specific language governing permissions and\r\n  limitations under the License.\r\n\r\n
    \ ============LICENSE_END============================================\r\n-->\r\n<!DOCTYPE
    xml>\r\n<configuration scan=\"true\" scanPeriod=\"3 seconds\" debug=\"true\">\r\n\r\n\t<!--
    specify the component name -->\r\n\t<property name=\"componentName\" value=\"onapportal\"></property>\r\n\r\n\t<!--
    specify the base path of the log directory -->\r\n\t<property name=\"logDirPrefix\"
    value=\"/var/log/onap\"></property>\r\n\r\n\t<!-- The directories where logs are
    written -->\r\n\t<property name=\"logDirectory\" value=\"${logDirPrefix}/${componentName}\"
    />\r\n\t<!-- Can easily relocate debug logs by modifying this path. -->\r\n\t<property
    name=\"debugLogDirectory\" value=\"${logDirPrefix}/${componentName}\" />\r\n\r\n\t<!--
    log file names -->\r\n\t<property name=\"generalLogName\" value=\"application\"
    />\r\n\t<property name=\"errorLogName\" value=\"error\" />\r\n\t<property name=\"metricsLogName\"
    value=\"metrics\" />\r\n\t<property name=\"auditLogName\" value=\"audit\" />\r\n\t<property
    name=\"debugLogName\" value=\"debug\" />\r\n\t<!-- These loggers are not used in
    code (yet). <property name=\"securityLogName\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"security\" /> <property
    name=\"policyLogName\" value=\"policy\" /> <property\r\n\t\tname=\"performanceLogName\"
    value=\"performance\" /> <property name=\"serverLogName\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"server\"
    /> -->\r\n\r\n\t<!-- ServerFQDN=Server,  -->\r\n\t<property name=\"auditLoggerPattern\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"%X{AuditLogBeginTimestamp}|%X{AuditLogEndTimestamp}|%X{RequestId}|%X{ServiceInstanceId}|%thread|%X{VirtualServerName}|%X{ServiceName}|%X{PartnerName}|%X{StatusCode}|%X{ResponseCode}|%X{ResponseDescription}|%X{InstanceUUID}|%.-5level|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ServerIPAddress}|%X{Timer}|%X{ServerFQDN}|%X{ClientIPAddress}|%X{ClassName}|%X{Unused}|%X{ProcessKey}|%X{CustomField1}|%X{CustomField2}|%X{CustomField3}|%X{CustomField4}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n\r\n\t<property name=\"metricsLoggerPattern\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"%X{MetricsLogBeginTimestamp}|%X{MetricsLogEndTimestamp}|%X{RequestId}|%X{ServiceInstanceId}|%thread|%X{VirtualServerName}|%X{ServiceName}|%X{PartnerName}|%X{TargetEntity}|%X{TargetServiceName}|%X{StatusCode}|%X{ResponseCode}|%X{ResponseDescription}|%X{InstanceUUID}|%.-5level|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ServerIPAddress}|%X{Timer}|%X{ServerFQDN}|%X{ClientIPAddress}|%X{ClassName}|%X{Unused}|%X{ProcessKey}|%X{TargetVisualEntity}|%X{CustomField1}|%X{CustomField2}|%X{CustomField3}|%X{CustomField4}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n\r\n\t<property name=\"errorLoggerPattern\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"%date{yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX}|%X{RequestId}|%thread|%X{ServiceName}|%X{PartnerName}|%X{TargetEntity}|%X{TargetServiceName}|%X{ClassName}|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ErrorCode}|%X{ErrorDescription}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n\r\n\t<property name=\"defaultLoggerPattern\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"%date{yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX}|%X{RequestId}|%thread|%X{ClassName}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n\r\n\t<!-- use %class so library logging calls yield their class
    name -->\r\n  \t<property name=\"applicationLoggerPattern\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"%date{yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX}|%X{RequestId}|%thread|%class{36}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n\r\n\t<!--\r\n\t<property name=\"defaultPattern\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"%date{ISO8601}|%X{RequestId}|%X{ServiceInstanceId}|%thread|%X{VirtualServerName}|%X{ServiceName}|%X{InstanceUUID}|%.-5level|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ServerIPAddress}|%X{ServerFQDN}|%X{RemoteHost}|%X{ClassName}|%X{Timer}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n\t<property name=\"debugLoggerPattern\"\r\n\t\tvalue=\"%date{ISO8601}|%X{RequestId}|%X{ServiceInstanceId}|%thread|%X{VirtualServerName}|%X{ServiceName}|%X{InstanceUUID}|%.-5level|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ServerIPAddress}|%X{ServerFQDN}|%X{RemoteHost}|%X{ClassName}|%X{Timer}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n\t -->\r\n\t<!-- <property name=\"debugLoggerPattern\" value=\"%date{ISO8601}|%X{RequestId}|%X{ServiceInstanceId}|%thread|%X{ServiceName}|%X{InstanceUUID}|%.-5level|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ServerIPAddress}|%X{ServerFQDN}|%X{RemoteHost}|%X{Timer}|[%caller{3}]|%msg%n\"\r\n\t\t/>
    -->\r\n\t<!-- Example evaluator filter applied against console appender -->\r\n\t<appender
    name=\"STDOUT\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender\">\r\n\t\t<encoder>\r\n\t\t\t<pattern>${applicationLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n\t\t</encoder>\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<!--
    ============================================================================ -->\r\n\t<!--
    EELF Appenders -->\r\n\t<!-- ============================================================================
    -->\r\n\r\n\t<!-- The EELFAppender is used to record events to the general application\r\n\t\tlog
    -->\r\n\r\n\r\n\t<appender name=\"EELF\"\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${generalLogName}.log</file>\r\n\t\t<rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t\t<!-- daily
    rollover -->\r\n\t\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${generalLogName}.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.zip\r\n\t\t\t</fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t\t<maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n\t\t</rollingPolicy>\r\n\t\t<encoder>\r\n\t\t\t<pattern>${applicationLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n\t\t</encoder>\r\n\t\t<filter
    class=\"org.openecomp.portalapp.portal.utils.CustomLoggingFilter\" />\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<appender
    name=\"asyncEELF\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n\t\t<!--
    Class name is part of caller data -->\r\n    \t<includeCallerData>true</includeCallerData>\r\n\t\t<appender-ref
    ref=\"EELF\" />\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<!-- EELF Security Appender. This appender
    is used to record security events\r\n\t\tto the security log file. Security events
    are separate from other loggers\r\n\t\tin EELF so that security log records can
    be captured and managed in a secure\r\n\t\tway separate from the other logs. This
    appender is set to never discard any\r\n\t\tevents. -->\r\n\t<!-- <appender name=\"EELFSecurity\"
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${securityLogName}.log</file>
    <rollingPolicy class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${securityLogName}.%i.log.zip
    </fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t<minIndex>1</minIndex> <maxIndex>9</maxIndex> </rollingPolicy>
    <triggeringPolicy\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\">
    <maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize>\r\n\t\t</triggeringPolicy> <encoder> <pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern>
    </encoder>\r\n\t\t</appender> <appender name=\"asyncEELFSecurity\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>
    <discardingThreshold>0</discardingThreshold> <appender-ref\r\n\t\tref=\"EELFSecurity\"
    /> </appender> -->\r\n\r\n\t<!-- EELF Performance Appender. This appender is used
    to record performance\r\n\t\trecords. -->\r\n\t<!-- <appender name=\"EELFPerformance\"
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${performanceLogName}.log</file>
    <rollingPolicy class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${performanceLogName}.%i.log.zip
    </fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t<minIndex>1</minIndex> <maxIndex>9</maxIndex> </rollingPolicy>
    <triggeringPolicy\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\">
    <maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize>\r\n\t\t</triggeringPolicy> <encoder> <outputPatternAsHeader>true</outputPatternAsHeader>\r\n\t\t<pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern>
    </encoder> </appender> <appender name=\"asyncEELFPerformance\"\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">
    <queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n\t\t<appender-ref ref=\"EELFPerformance\" /> </appender>
    -->\r\n\r\n\t<!-- EELF Server Appender. This appender is used to record Server related\r\n\t\tlogging
    events. The Server logger and appender are specializations of the\r\n\t\tEELF application
    root logger and appender. This can be used to segregate\r\n\t\tServer events from
    other components, or it can be eliminated to record these\r\n\t\tevents as part
    of the application root log. -->\r\n\t<!-- <appender name=\"EELFServer\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${serverLogName}.log</file>
    <rollingPolicy class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${serverLogName}.%i.log.zip
    </fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t<minIndex>1</minIndex> <maxIndex>9</maxIndex> </rollingPolicy>
    <triggeringPolicy\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\">
    <maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize>\r\n\t\t</triggeringPolicy> <encoder> <pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern>
    </encoder>\r\n\t\t</appender> <appender name=\"asyncEELFServer\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>
    <appender-ref ref=\"EELFServer\" /> </appender> -->\r\n\r\n\t<!-- EELF Policy Appender.
    This appender is used to record Policy engine\r\n\t\trelated logging events. The
    Policy logger and appender are specializations\r\n\t\tof the EELF application root
    logger and appender. This can be used to segregate\r\n\t\tPolicy engine events from
    other components, or it can be eliminated to record\r\n\t\tthese events as part
    of the application root log. -->\r\n\t<!-- <appender name=\"EELFPolicy\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${policyLogName}.log</file>
    <rollingPolicy class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${policyLogName}.%i.log.zip
    </fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t<minIndex>1</minIndex> <maxIndex>9</maxIndex> </rollingPolicy>
    <triggeringPolicy\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\">
    <maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize>\r\n\t\t</triggeringPolicy> <encoder> <pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern>
    </encoder>\r\n\t\t</appender> <appender name=\"asyncEELFPolicy\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>
    <appender-ref ref=\"EELFPolicy\" /> </appender> -->\r\n\r\n\t<!-- EELF Audit Appender.
    This appender is used to record audit engine related\r\n\t\tlogging events. The
    audit logger and appender are specializations of the\r\n\t\tEELF application root
    logger and appender. This can be used to segregate\r\n\t\tPolicy engine events from
    other components, or it can be eliminated to record\r\n\t\tthese events as part
    of the application root log. -->\r\n\r\n\t<appender name=\"EELFAudit\"\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${auditLogName}.log</file>\r\n\t\t<rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t\t<!-- daily
    roll over -->\r\n\t\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${auditLogName}.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.zip\r\n\t\t\t</fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t\t<maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n\t\t</rollingPolicy>\r\n\t\t<encoder>\r\n\t\t\t<pattern>${auditLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n\t\t</encoder>\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\t<appender
    name=\"asyncEELFAudit\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n\t\t<appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFAudit\" />\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<appender name=\"EELFMetrics\"\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${metricsLogName}.log</file>\r\n\t\t<rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t\t<!-- daily
    roll over -->\r\n\t\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${metricsLogName}.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.zip\r\n\t\t\t</fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t\t<maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n\t\t</rollingPolicy>\r\n\t\t<encoder>\r\n\t\t\t<pattern>${metricsLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n\t\t</encoder>\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\r\n\t<appender
    name=\"asyncEELFMetrics\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n\t\t<appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFMetrics\" />\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<appender name=\"EELFError\"\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${logDirectory}/${errorLogName}.log</file>\r\n\t\t<rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t\t<!-- daily
    roll over -->\r\n\t\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${errorLogName}.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.zip\r\n\t\t\t</fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t\t<maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n\t\t</rollingPolicy>\r\n\t\t<encoder>\r\n\t\t\t<pattern>${errorLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n\t\t</encoder>\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<appender
    name=\"asyncEELFError\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n\t\t<appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFError\" />\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<appender name=\"EELFDebug\"\r\n\t\tclass=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n\t\t<file>${debugLogDirectory}/${debugLogName}.log</file>\r\n\t\t<rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n\t\t\t<!-- daily
    roll over -->\r\n\t\t\t<fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${debugLogName}.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.zip\r\n\t\t\t</fileNamePattern>\r\n\t\t\t<maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n\t\t</rollingPolicy>\r\n\t\t<encoder>\r\n\t\t\t<pattern>${defaultLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n\t\t</encoder>\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\t<appender
    name=\"asyncEELFDebug\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n\t\t<queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n\t\t<appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFDebug\" />\r\n\t\t<includeCallerData>true</includeCallerData>\r\n\t</appender>\r\n\r\n\r\n\t<!--
    ============================================================================ -->\r\n\t<!--
    EELF loggers -->\r\n\t<!-- ============================================================================
    -->\r\n\t<logger name=\"com.att.eelf\" level=\"info\" additivity=\"false\">\r\n\t\t<appender-ref
    ref=\"asyncEELF\" />\r\n\t</logger>\r\n\r\n\t<!-- <logger name=\"com.att.eelf.security\"
    level=\"info\" additivity=\"false\">\r\n\t\t<appender-ref ref=\"asyncEELFSecurity\"
    /> </logger> <logger name=\"com.att.eelf.perf\"\r\n\t\tlevel=\"info\" additivity=\"false\">
    <appender-ref ref=\"asyncEELFPerformance\"\r\n\t\t/> </logger> <logger name=\"com.att.eelf.server\"
    level=\"info\" additivity=\"false\">\r\n\t\t<appender-ref ref=\"asyncEELFServer\"

    level=\"info\" additivity=\"false\">\r\n\t\t<appender-ref ref=\"asyncEELFAudit\"
    />\r\n\t</logger>\r\n\r\n\t<logger name=\"com.att.eelf.metrics\" level=\"info\"

    />\r\n\t</logger>\r\n\r\n\t<root level=\"INFO\">\r\n\t\t<appender-ref ref=\"asyncEELF\"
    />\r\n\t</root>\r\n\r\n</configuration>\r\n"

    music.version = v2
    music.keyspace = keyspaces
    music.session.keyspace = portal
    music.tables = tables
    music.session.attr.tables = spring_session_attributes
    music.session.meta.tables = spring_session
    music.consistency.info = type
    music.consistency.info.value = eventual
    music.cache = false
    music.session.max.inactive.interval.seconds = 1800
    music.serialize.compress = true
  
    #By default it's eventual
    music.atomic.get = false
    music.atomic.put = true
    cassandra.host=portal-cassandra
    zookeeper.host=portal-zookeeper

    Note:  A \"Server\" is not itself a \"Container\", so you may not\n     define subcomponents
    such as \"Valves\" at this level.\n     Documentation at /docs/config/server.html\n
    -->\n<Server port=\"8005\" shutdown=\"SHUTDOWN\">\n  <Listener className=\"org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener\"
    />\n  <!-- Security listener. Documentation at /docs/config/listeners.html\n  <Listener
    className=\"org.apache.catalina.security.SecurityListener\" />\n  -->\n  <!--APR
    library loader. Documentation at /docs/apr.html -->\n  <Listener className=\"org.apache.catalina.core.AprLifecycleListener\"
    SSLEngine=\"on\" />\n  <!-- Prevent memory leaks due to use of particular java/javax
    APIs-->\n  <Listener className=\"org.apache.catalina.core.JreMemoryLeakPreventionListener\"
    />\n  <Listener className=\"org.apache.catalina.mbeans.GlobalResourcesLifecycleListener\"
    />\n  <Listener className=\"org.apache.catalina.core.ThreadLocalLeakPreventionListener\"
    />\n\n  <!-- Global JNDI resources\n       Documentation at /docs/jndi-resources-howto.html\n
    \ -->\n  <GlobalNamingResources>\n    <!-- Editable user database that can also
    be used by\n         UserDatabaseRealm to authenticate users\n    -->\n    <Resource
    name=\"UserDatabase\" auth=\"Container\"\n              type=\"org.apache.catalina.UserDatabase\"\n
    \             description=\"User database that can be updated and saved\"\n              factory=\"org.apache.catalina.users.MemoryUserDatabaseFactory\"\n
    \             pathname=\"conf/tomcat-users.xml\" />\n  </GlobalNamingResources>\n\n
    \ <!-- A \"Service\" is a collection of one or more \"Connectors\" that share\n
    \      a single \"Container\" Note:  A \"Service\" is not itself a \"Container\",\n
    \      so you may not define subcomponents such as \"Valves\" at this level.\n       Documentation
    at /docs/config/service.html\n   -->\n  <Service name=\"Catalina\">\n\n    <!--The
    connectors can use a shared executor, you can define one or more named thread pools-->\n
    \   <!--\n    <Executor name=\"tomcatThreadPool\" namePrefix=\"catalina-exec-\"\n
    \       maxThreads=\"150\" minSpareThreads=\"4\"/>\n    -->\n\n\n    <!-- A \"Connector\"
    represents an endpoint by which requests are received\n         and responses are
    returned. Documentation at :\n         Java HTTP Connector: /docs/config/http.html
    (blocking & non-blocking)\n         Java AJP  Connector: /docs/config/ajp.html\n
    \        APR (HTTP/AJP) Connector: /docs/apr.html\n         Define a non-SSL/TLS
    HTTP/1.1 Connector on port 8080\n    -->\n    <Connector port=\"8080\" protocol=\"HTTP/1.1\"\n
    \              connectionTimeout=\"20000\"\n               redirectPort=\"8443\"
    />\n    <!-- A \"Connector\" using the shared thread pool-->\n    <!--\n    <Connector
    executor=\"tomcatThreadPool\"\n               port=\"8080\" protocol=\"HTTP/1.1\"\n
    \              connectionTimeout=\"20000\"\n               redirectPort=\"8443\"
    />\n    -->\n    <!-- Define a SSL/TLS HTTP/1.1 Connector on port 8443\n         This
    connector uses the NIO implementation that requires the JSSE\n         style configuration.
    When using the APR/native implementation, the\n         OpenSSL style configuration
    is required as described in the APR/native\n         documentation -->\n    <!--\n
    \   <Connector port=\"8443\" protocol=\"org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol\"\n
    \              maxThreads=\"150\" SSLEnabled=\"true\" scheme=\"https\" secure=\"true\"\n
    \              clientAuth=\"false\" sslProtocol=\"TLS\" />\n    -->\n\t\n\t <Connector
    port=\"8443\" protocol=\"org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol\"\n               maxThreads=\"150\"

    \   <!-- An Engine represents the entry point (within Catalina) that processes\n
    \        every request.  The Engine implementation for Tomcat stand alone\n         analyzes
    the HTTP headers included with the request, and passes them\n         on to the
    appropriate Host (virtual host).\n         Documentation at /docs/config/engine.html
    -->\n\n    <!-- You should set jvmRoute to support load-balancing via AJP ie :\n
    \   <Engine name=\"Catalina\" defaultHost=\"localhost\" jvmRoute=\"jvm1\">\n    -->\n

    a brute-force attack -->\n      <Realm className=\"org.apache.catalina.realm.LockOutRealm\">\n

  name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra-docker-entry-initd
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-cassandra
    chart: portal-cassandra-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  portal.cql: |
    // Copyright  2018 Amdocs, Bell Canada, AT&T
    //
    // Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    // you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    // You may obtain a copy of the License at
    //
    //       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    //
    // Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    // distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    // WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    // See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    // limitations under the License.
  
    CREATE KEYSPACE IF NOT EXISTS portal
        WITH REPLICATION = {
            'class' : 'SimpleStrategy',
            'replication_factor': 1
        }
        AND DURABLE_WRITES = true;
  
  
    CREATE TABLE portal.spring_session (
        primary_id text PRIMARY KEY,
        creation_time text,
        expiry_time text,
        last_access_time text,
        max_inactive_interval text,
        principal_name text,
        session_id text,
        vector_ts text
    ) WITH bloom_filter_fp_chance = 0.01
        AND caching = {'keys': 'ALL', 'rows_per_partition': '10'}
        AND comment = ''
        AND compaction = {'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.SizeTieredCompactionStrategy', 'max_threshold': '32', 'min_threshold': '4'}
        AND compression = {'chunk_length_in_kb': '64', 'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.LZ4Compressor'}
        AND crc_check_chance = 1.0
        AND dclocal_read_repair_chance = 0.1
        AND default_time_to_live = 0
        AND gc_grace_seconds = 864000
        AND max_index_interval = 2048
        AND memtable_flush_period_in_ms = 0
        AND min_index_interval = 128
        AND read_repair_chance = 0.0
        AND speculative_retry = '99PERCENTILE';
  
  
    CREATE TABLE portal.spring_session_attributes (
        primary_id text,
        attribute_name text,
        attribute_bytes blob,
        vector_ts text,
        PRIMARY KEY (primary_id, attribute_name)
    ) WITH CLUSTERING ORDER BY (attribute_name ASC)
        AND bloom_filter_fp_chance = 0.01
        AND caching = {'keys': 'ALL', 'rows_per_partition': '1'}
        AND comment = ''
        AND compaction = {'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.SizeTieredCompactionStrategy', 'max_threshold': '32', 'min_threshold': '4'}
        AND compression = {'chunk_length_in_kb': '64', 'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.LZ4Compressor'}
        AND crc_check_chance = 1.0
        AND dclocal_read_repair_chance = 0.1
        AND default_time_to_live = 0
        AND gc_grace_seconds = 864000
        AND max_index_interval = 2048
        AND memtable_flush_period_in_ms = 0
        AND min_index_interval = 128
        AND read_repair_chance = 0.0
        AND speculative_retry = '99PERCENTILE';

    // Copyright  2018 Amdocs, Bell Canada, AT&T
    //
    // Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    // you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    // You may obtain a copy of the License at

    // Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    // distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    // WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    // See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    // limitations under the License.
  
    CREATE KEYSPACE IF NOT EXISTS portalsdk
        WITH REPLICATION = {
            'class' : 'SimpleStrategy',
            'replication_factor': 1
        }
        AND DURABLE_WRITES = true;
  
  
    CREATE TABLE portalsdk.spring_session (
        primary_id text PRIMARY KEY,
        creation_time text,
        expiry_time text,
        last_access_time text,
        max_inactive_interval text,
        principal_name text,
        session_id text,
        vector_ts text
    ) WITH bloom_filter_fp_chance = 0.01
        AND caching = {'keys': 'ALL', 'rows_per_partition': '10'}
        AND comment = ''
        AND compaction = {'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.SizeTieredCompactionStrategy', 'max_threshold': '32', 'min_threshold': '4'}
        AND compression = {'chunk_length_in_kb': '64', 'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.LZ4Compressor'}
        AND crc_check_chance = 1.0
        AND dclocal_read_repair_chance = 0.1
        AND default_time_to_live = 0
        AND gc_grace_seconds = 864000
        AND max_index_interval = 2048
        AND memtable_flush_period_in_ms = 0
        AND min_index_interval = 128
        AND read_repair_chance = 0.0
        AND speculative_retry = '99PERCENTILE';
  
  
    CREATE TABLE portalsdk.spring_session_attributes (
        primary_id text,
        attribute_name text,
        attribute_bytes blob,
        vector_ts text,
        PRIMARY KEY (primary_id, attribute_name)
    ) WITH CLUSTERING ORDER BY (attribute_name ASC)
        AND bloom_filter_fp_chance = 0.01
        AND caching = {'keys': 'ALL', 'rows_per_partition': '1'}
        AND comment = ''
        AND compaction = {'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.SizeTieredCompactionStrategy', 'max_threshold': '32', 'min_threshold': '4'}
        AND compression = {'chunk_length_in_kb': '64', 'class': 'org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.LZ4Compressor'}
        AND crc_check_chance = 1.0
        AND dclocal_read_repair_chance = 0.1
        AND default_time_to_live = 0
        AND gc_grace_seconds = 864000
        AND max_index_interval = 2048
        AND memtable_flush_period_in_ms = 0
        AND min_index_interval = 128
        AND read_repair_chance = 0.0
        AND speculative_retry = '99PERCENTILE';
---
# Source: portal/charts/portal-mariadb/templates/configmap.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
# Modifications Copyright  2018 AT&T
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-portal-portal-db-mariadb
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-db
    chart: portal-mariadb-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  docker-entrypoint.sh: "#!/bin/bash\nset -eo pipefail\nshopt -s nullglob\n\n# if command
    starts with an option, prepend mysqld\nif [ \"${1:0:1}\" = '-' ]; then\n\tset --
    mysqld \"$@\"\nfi\n\n# skip setup if they want an option that stops mysqld\nwantHelp=\nfor
    arg; do\n\tcase \"$arg\" in\n\t\t-'?'|--help|--print-defaults|-V|--version)\n\t\t\twantHelp=1\n\t\t\tbreak\n\t\t\t;;\n\tesac\ndone\n\n#
    usage: file_env VAR [DEFAULT]\n#    ie: file_env 'XYZ_DB_PASSWORD' 'example'\n#
    (will allow for \"$XYZ_DB_PASSWORD_FILE\" to fill in the value of\n#  \"$XYZ_DB_PASSWORD\"
    from a file, especially for Docker's secrets feature)\nfile_env() {\n\tlocal var=\"$1\"\n\tlocal
    fileVar=\"${var}_FILE\"\n\tlocal def=\"${2:-}\"\n\tif [ \"${!var:-}\" ] && [ \"${!fileVar:-}\"
    ]; then\n\t\techo >&2 \"error: both $var and $fileVar are set (but are exclusive)\"\n\t\texit
    1\n\tfi\n\tlocal val=\"$def\"\n\tif [ \"${!var:-}\" ]; then\n\t\tval=\"${!var}\"\n\telif
    [ \"${!fileVar:-}\" ]; then\n\t\tval=\"$(< \"${!fileVar}\")\"\n\tfi\n\texport \"$var\"=\"$val\"\n\tunset
    \"$fileVar\"\n}\n\n_check_config() {\n\ttoRun=( \"$@\" --verbose --help --log-bin-index=\"$(mktemp
    -u)\" )\n\tif ! errors=\"$(\"${toRun[@]}\" 2>&1 >/dev/null)\"; then\n\t\tcat >&2
    <<-EOM\n\t\t\tERROR: mysqld failed while attempting to check config\n\t\t\tcommand
    was: \"${toRun[*]}\"\n\t\t\t$errors\n\t\tEOM\n\t\texit 1\n\tfi\n}\n\n# Fetch value
    from server config\n# We use mysqld --verbose --help instead of my_print_defaults
    because the\n# latter only show values present in config files, and not server defaults\n_get_config()
    {\n\tlocal conf=\"$1\"; shift\n\t\"$@\" --verbose --help --log-bin-index=\"$(mktemp
    -u)\" 2>/dev/null \\\n\t\t| awk '$1 == \"'\"$conf\"'\" && /^[^ \\t]/ { sub(/^[^
    \\t]+[ \\t]+/, \"\"); print; exit }'\n\t# match \"datadir      /some/path with/spaces
    in/it here\" but not \"--xyz=abc\\n     datadir (xyz)\"\n}\n\n# allow the container
    to be started with `--user`\nif [ \"$1\" = 'mysqld' -a -z \"$wantHelp\" -a \"$(id
    -u)\" = '0' ]; then\n\t_check_config \"$@\"\n\tDATADIR=\"$(_get_config 'datadir'
    \"$@\")\"\n\tmkdir -p \"$DATADIR\"\n\tfind \"$DATADIR\" \\! -user mysql -exec chown
    mysql '{}' +\n\texec gosu mysql \"$BASH_SOURCE\" \"$@\"\nfi\n\nif [ \"$1\" = 'mysqld'
    -a -z \"$wantHelp\" ]; then\n\t# still need to check config, container may have
    started with --user\n\t_check_config \"$@\"\n\t# Get config\n\tDATADIR=\"$(_get_config
    'datadir' \"$@\")\"\n\n\tif [ ! -d \"$DATADIR/mysql\" ]; then\n\t\tfile_env 'MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD'\n\t\tif
    [ -z \"$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD\" -a -z \"$MYSQL_ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD\" -a -z \"$MYSQL_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD\"
    ]; then\n\t\t\techo >&2 'error: database is uninitialized and password option is
    not specified '\n\t\t\techo >&2 '  You need to specify one of MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD,
    MYSQL_ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD and MYSQL_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD'\n\t\t\texit 1\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\tmkdir
    -p \"$DATADIR\"\n\n\t\techo 'Initializing database'\n\t\tinstallArgs=( --datadir=\"$DATADIR\"
    --rpm )\n\t\tif { mysql_install_db --help || :; } | grep -q -- '--auth-root-authentication-method';
    then\n\t\t\t# beginning in 10.4.3, install_db uses \"socket\" which only allows
    system user root to connect, switch back to \"normal\" to allow mysql root without
    a password\n\t\t\t# see https://github.com/MariaDB/server/commit/b9f3f06857ac6f9105dc65caae19782f09b47fb3\n\t\t\t#
    (this flag doesn't exist in 10.0 and below)\n\t\t\tinstallArgs+=( --auth-root-authentication-method=normal
    )\n\t\tfi\n\t\t# \"Other options are passed to mysqld.\" (so we pass all \"mysqld\"
    arguments directly here)\n\t\tmysql_install_db \"${installArgs[@]}\" \"${@:2}\"\n\t\techo
    'Database initialized'\n\n\t\tSOCKET=\"$(_get_config 'socket' \"$@\")\"\n\t\t\"$@\"
    --skip-networking --socket=\"${SOCKET}\" &\n\t\tpid=\"$!\"\n\n\t\tmysql=( mysql
    --protocol=socket -uroot -hlocalhost --socket=\"${SOCKET}\" )\n\n\t\tfor i in {60..0};
    do\n\t\t\tif echo 'SELECT 1' | \"${mysql[@]}\" &> /dev/null; then\n\t\t\t\tbreak\n\t\t\tfi\n\t\t\techo
    'MySQL init process in progress...'\n\t\t\tsleep 1\n\t\tdone\n\t\tif [ \"$i\" =
    0 ]; then\n\t\t\techo >&2 'MySQL init process failed.'\n\t\t\texit 1\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\tif
    [ -z \"$MYSQL_INITDB_SKIP_TZINFO\" ]; then\n\t\t\t# sed is for https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=20545\n\t\t\tmysql_tzinfo_to_sql
    /usr/share/zoneinfo | sed 's/Local time zone must be set--see zic manual page/FCTY/'
    | \"${mysql[@]}\" mysql\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\tif [ ! -z \"$MYSQL_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD\"
    ]; then\n\t\t\texport MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=\"$(pwgen -1 32)\"\n\t\t\techo \"GENERATED
    ROOT PASSWORD: $MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD\"\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\trootCreate=\n\t\t# default
    root to listen for connections from anywhere\n\t\tfile_env 'MYSQL_ROOT_HOST' '%'\n\t\tif
    [ ! -z \"$MYSQL_ROOT_HOST\" -a \"$MYSQL_ROOT_HOST\" != 'localhost' ]; then\n\t\t\t#
    no, we don't care if read finds a terminating character in this heredoc\n\t\t\t#
    https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/265149/why-is-set-o-errexit-breaking-this-read-heredoc-expression/265151#265151\n\t\t\tread
    -r -d '' rootCreate <<-EOSQL || true\n\t\t\t\tCREATE USER 'root'@'${MYSQL_ROOT_HOST}'
    IDENTIFIED BY '${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD}' ;\n\t\t\t\tGRANT ALL ON *.* TO 'root'@'${MYSQL_ROOT_HOST}'
    WITH GRANT OPTION ;\n\t\t\tEOSQL\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\t\"${mysql[@]}\" <<-EOSQL\n\t\t\t--
    What's done in this file shouldn't be replicated\n\t\t\t--  or products like mysql-fabric
    won't work\n\t\t\tSET @@SESSION.SQL_LOG_BIN=0;\n\t\t\tDELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE
    user NOT IN ('mysql.sys', 'mysqlxsys', 'root') OR host NOT IN ('localhost') ;\n\t\t\tSET
    PASSWORD FOR 'root'@'localhost'=PASSWORD('${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD}') ;\n\t\t\tGRANT
    ALL ON *.* TO 'root'@'localhost' WITH GRANT OPTION ;\n\t\t\t${rootCreate}\n\t\t\tDROP
    DATABASE IF EXISTS test ;\n\t\t\tFLUSH PRIVILEGES ;\n\t\tEOSQL\n\n\t\tif [ ! -z
    \"$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD\" ]; then\n\t\t\tmysql+=( -p\"${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD}\" )\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\tfile_env
    'MYSQL_DATABASE'\n\t\tif [ \"$MYSQL_DATABASE\" ]; then\n\t\t\techo \"CREATE DATABASE
    IF NOT EXISTS \\`$MYSQL_DATABASE\\` ;\" | \"${mysql[@]}\"\n\t\t\tmysql+=( \"$MYSQL_DATABASE\"
    )\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\tfile_env 'MYSQL_USER'\n\t\tfile_env 'MYSQL_PASSWORD'\n\t\tif [
    \"$MYSQL_USER\" -a \"$MYSQL_PASSWORD\" ]; then\n\t\t\techo \"CREATE USER '$MYSQL_USER'@'%'
    IDENTIFIED BY '$MYSQL_PASSWORD' ;\" | \"${mysql[@]}\"\n\n\t\t\tif [ \"$MYSQL_DATABASE\"
    ]; then\n\t\t\t\techo \"GRANT ALL ON \\`$MYSQL_DATABASE\\`.* TO '$MYSQL_USER'@'%'
    ;\" | \"${mysql[@]}\"\n\t\t\tfi\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\techo\n\t\tfor f in /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/*;
    do\n\t\t\tcase \"$f\" in\n\t\t\t\t*.sh)     echo \"$0: running $f\"; . \"$f\" ;;\n\t\t\t\t*.sql)
    \   echo \"$0: running $f\"; \"${mysql[@]}\" < \"$f\"; echo ;;\n\t\t\t\t*.sql.gz)
    echo \"$0: running $f\"; gunzip -c \"$f\" | \"${mysql[@]}\"; echo ;;\n\t\t\t\t*)
    \       echo \"$0: ignoring $f\" ;;\n\t\t\tesac\n\t\t\techo\n\t\tdone\n\n\t\tif
    ! kill -s TERM \"$pid\" || ! wait \"$pid\"; then\n\t\t\techo >&2 'MySQL init process
    failed.'\n\t\t\texit 1\n\t\tfi\n\n\t\techo\n\t\techo 'MySQL init process done. Ready
    for start up.'\n\t\techo\n\tfi\nfi\n\nexec \"$@\""
  oom_updates.sql: "/*\n# Copyright  2018 Amdocs, Bell Canada, AT&T\n#\n# Licensed

    is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
    KIND, either express or implied.\n# See the License for the specific language governing
    permissions and\n# limitations under the License.\n\n*/\n\nUSE portal;\n/*\nAny
    updates required by OOM to the portaldb are made here.\n1. split up SDC-FE and SDC-BE.
    \ Originally both FE and BE point to the same IP\nwhile the OOM K8s version has
    these service split up.\n*/\n-- app_url is the FE, app_rest_endpoint is the BE\n--portal-sdk
    => TODO: doesn't open a node port yet\nupdate fn_app set app_url = 'http://portal-sdk.simpledemo.onap.org:30212/ONAPPORTALSDK/welcome.htm',
    app_rest_endpoint = 'http://portal-sdk:8080/ONAPPORTALSDK/api/v3' where app_name
    = 'xDemo App';\n--dmaap-bc => the dmaap-bc doesn't open a node port..\nupdate fn_app
    set app_url = 'http://dmaap-bc.simpledemo.onap.org:/ECOMPDBCAPP/dbc#/dmaap',
    app_rest_endpoint = 'http://dmaap-bc:8989/ECOMPDBCAPP/api/v2' where app_name = 'DMaaP
    Bus Ctrl';\n--sdc-be => 8443:30204, 8080:30205\n--sdc-fe => 8181:30206, 9443:30207\nupdate
    fn_app set app_url = 'https://sdc.api.fe.simpledemo.onap.org:30207/sdc1/portal',
    app_rest_endpoint = 'https://sdc-be:8443/api/v3' where app_name = 'SDC';\n--pap
    => 8443:30219\nupdate fn_app set app_url = 'https://policy.api.simpledemo.onap.org:30219/onap/policy',
    app_rest_endpoint = 'https://pap:8443/onap/api/v3' where app_name = 'Policy';\n--vid
    => 8080:30200\nupdate fn_app set app_url = 'https://vid.api.simpledemo.onap.org:30200/vid/welcome.htm',
    app_rest_endpoint = 'https://vid:8443/vid/api/v3' where app_name = 'Virtual Infrastructure
    Deployment';\n--sparky => TODO: sparky doesn't open a node port yet\nupdate fn_app
    set app_url = 'https://aai.ui.simpledemo.onap.org:30220/services/aai/webapp/index.html#/viewInspect',
    app_rest_endpoint = 'https://aai-sparky-be.onap:8000/api/v2' where
    app_name = 'A&AI UI';\n--cli => 8080:30260\nupdate fn_app set app_url = 'http://cli.api.simpledemo.onap.org:30260/',
    app_type = 1 where app_name = 'CLI';\n--msb-iag => 80:30280\nupdate fn_app set app_url
    = 'http://msb.api.simpledemo.onap.org:30280/iui/microservices/default.html'
    where app_name = 'MSB';\n\n\n/*\nCreate SO-Monitoring App\n*/\nINSERT IGNORE INTO
    `fn_app` (`app_id`, `app_name`, `app_image_url`, `app_description`, `app_notes`,

kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-portal-portal-sdk-onapportalsdk
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-sdk
    chart: portal-sdk-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  fusion.properties: |
    # Copyright  2018 Amdocs, Bell Canada, AT&T
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    # login settings
    login_method_backdoor       = backdoor
    login_method_attribute_name = login_method
  
    # These properties will be removed after SingleSignOnController is cleaned
    authentication_mechanism = BOTH
    login_method_csp            = csp
    login_method_web_junction   = web_junction
  
    #login message
    login.error.hrid.empty = Login failed, please contact system administrator.
    login.error.hrid.not-found = User not found, please contact system administrator.
    login.error.user.inactive = Account is disabled, please contact system administrator.
  
    # User Session settings
    user_attribute_name           = user
    roles_attribute_name          = roles
    role_function_list = role_function_list
    role_functions_attribute_name = role_functions
  
    # Import-user LDAP settings
    post_initial_context_factory = com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory
    post_provider_url            = ldap://ldap.mycompany.com:389
    post_security_principal      = ou=people,o=mycompany,c=us
    post_max_result_size         = 499

    menu_query_name                      = menuData
    application_menu_set_name            = APP
    application_menu_attribute_name      = applicationMenuData
    business_direct_menu_set_name        = BD
    business_direct_menu_attribute_name  = businessDirectMenuData

    sys_admin_role_id = 1
  logback.xml: "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\r\n<!--\r\n  ============LICENSE_START==========================================\r\n

    \ ============LICENSE_END============================================\r\n\r\n  -->\r\n<configuration
    scan=\"true\" scanPeriod=\"3 seconds\" debug=\"true\">\r\n  <!--<jmxConfigurator
    /> -->\r\n  <!--  specify the component name -->\r\n  <property name=\"componentName\"
    value=\"onapsdk\"></property>\r\n  <!--  specify the base path of the log directory
    -->\r\n  <property name=\"logDirPrefix\" value=\"/var/log/onap\"></property>\r\n
    \ <!-- The directories where logs are written -->\r\n  <property name=\"logDirectory\"
    value=\"${logDirPrefix}/${componentName}\" />\r\n  <!-- Can easily relocate debug
    logs by modifying this path. -->\r\n  <property name=\"debugLogDirectory\" value=\"${logDirPrefix}/${componentName}\"
    />\r\n  <!--  log file names -->\r\n  <property name=\"generalLogName\" value=\"application\"
    />\r\n  <property name=\"errorLogName\" value=\"error\" />\r\n  <property name=\"metricsLogName\"
    value=\"metrics\" />\r\n  <property name=\"auditLogName\" value=\"audit\" />\r\n
    \ <property name=\"debugLogName\" value=\"debug\" />\r\n  <!--\r\n  These loggers
    are not used in code (yet).\r\n  <property name=\"securityLogName\" value=\"security\"
    /><property name=\"policyLogName\" value=\"policy\" /><property name=\"performanceLogName\"
    value=\"performance\" /><property name=\"serverLogName\" value=\"server\" />\r\n
    \  -->\r\n  <!-- 1610 Logging Fields Format Revisions -->\r\n  <property name=\"auditLoggerPattern\"
    value=\"%X{AuditLogBeginTimestamp}|%X{AuditLogEndTimestamp}|%X{RequestId}|%X{ServiceInstanceId}|%thread|%X{VirtualServerName}|%X{ServiceName}|%X{PartnerName}|%X{StatusCode}|%X{ResponseCode}|%X{ResponseDescription}|%X{InstanceUUID}|%.-5level|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ServerIPAddress}|%X{Timer}|%X{ServerFQDN}|%X{ClientIPAddress}|%X{ClassName}|%X{Unused}|%X{ProcessKey}|%X{CustomField1}|%X{CustomField2}|%X{CustomField3}|%X{CustomField4}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n  <property name=\"metricsLoggerPattern\" value=\"%X{MetricsLogBeginTimestamp}|%X{MetricsLogEndTimestamp}|%X{RequestId}|%X{ServiceInstanceId}|%thread|%X{VirtualServerName}|%X{ServiceName}|%X{PartnerName}|%X{TargetEntity}|%X{TargetServiceName}|%X{StatusCode}|%X{ResponseCode}|%X{ResponseDescription}|%X{InstanceUUID}|%.-5level|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ServerIPAddress}|%X{Timer}|%X{ServerFQDN}|%X{ClientIPAddress}|%X{ClassName}|%X{Unused}|%X{ProcessKey}|%X{TargetVisualEntity}|%X{CustomField1}|%X{CustomField2}|%X{CustomField3}|%X{CustomField4}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n  <property name=\"errorLoggerPattern\" value=\"%date{yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX}|%X{RequestId}|%thread|%X{ServiceName}|%X{PartnerName}|%X{TargetEntity}|%X{TargetServiceName}|%X{ClassName}|%X{AlertSeverity}|%X{ErrorCode}|%X{ErrorDescription}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n  <property name=\"defaultLoggerPattern\" value=\"%date{yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX}|%X{RequestId}|%thread|%X{ClassName}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n  <!-- use %class so library logging calls yield their class name
    -->\r\n  <property name=\"applicationLoggerPattern\" value=\"%date{yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX}|%X{RequestId}|%thread|%class{36}|
    %msg%n\" />\r\n  <!-- Example evaluator filter applied against console appender
    -->\r\n  <appender name=\"STDOUT\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender\">\r\n
    \   <encoder>\r\n      <pattern>${defaultLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n    </encoder>\r\n
    \ </appender>\r\n  <!-- ============================================================================
    -->\r\n  <!-- EELF Appenders -->\r\n  <!-- ============================================================================
    -->\r\n  <!-- The EELFAppender is used to record events to the general application\r\n
    \   log -->\r\n  <appender name=\"EELF\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n
    \   <file>${logDirectory}/${generalLogName}.log</file>\r\n    <rollingPolicy class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n
    \     <!-- daily rollover -->\r\n      <fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${generalLogName}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log.zip</fileNamePattern>\r\n
    \     <!-- keep 30 days' worth of history capped at 3GB total size -->\r\n      <maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n
    \     <totalSizeCap>3GB</totalSizeCap>\r\n    </rollingPolicy>\r\n    <encoder>\r\n
    \     <pattern>${applicationLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n    </encoder>\r\n    <filter
    class=\"org.onap.portalapp.util.CustomLoggingFilter\" />\r\n  </appender>\r\n  <appender
    name=\"asyncEELF\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n    <queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n
    \   <!-- Class name is part of caller data -->\r\n    <includeCallerData>true</includeCallerData>\r\n
    \   <appender-ref ref=\"EELF\" />\r\n  </appender>\r\n  <!-- EELF Security Appender.
    This appender is used to record security events\r\n    to the security log file.
    Security events are separate from other loggers\r\n    in EELF so that security
    log records can be captured and managed in a secure\r\n    way separate from the
    other logs. This appender is set to never discard any\r\n    events. -->\r\n  <!--\r\n
    \ <appender name=\"EELFSecurity\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\"><file>${logDirectory}/${securityLogName}.log</file><rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\"><fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${securityLogName}.%i.log.zip\r\n
    \     </fileNamePattern><minIndex>1</minIndex><maxIndex>9</maxIndex></rollingPolicy><triggeringPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\"><maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize></triggeringPolicy><encoder><pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern></encoder></appender><appender
    name=\"asyncEELFSecurity\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\"><queueSize>256</queueSize><discardingThreshold>0</discardingThreshold><appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFSecurity\" /></appender>\r\n   -->\r\n  <!-- EELF Performance Appender.
    This appender is used to record performance\r\n    records. -->\r\n  <!--\r\n  <appender
    name=\"EELFPerformance\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\"><file>${logDirectory}/${performanceLogName}.log</file><rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\"><fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${performanceLogName}.%i.log.zip\r\n
    \     </fileNamePattern><minIndex>1</minIndex><maxIndex>9</maxIndex></rollingPolicy><triggeringPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\"><maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize></triggeringPolicy><encoder><outputPatternAsHeader>true</outputPatternAsHeader><pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern></encoder></appender><appender
    name=\"asyncEELFPerformance\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\"><queueSize>256</queueSize><appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFPerformance\" /></appender>\r\n  -->\r\n  <!-- EELF Server Appender. This
    appender is used to record Server related\r\n    logging events. The Server logger
    and appender are specializations of the\r\n    EELF application root logger and
    appender. This can be used to segregate Server\r\n    events from other components,
    or it can be eliminated to record these events\r\n    as part of the application
    root log. -->\r\n  <!--\r\n  <appender name=\"EELFServer\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\"><file>${logDirectory}/${serverLogName}.log</file><rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\"><fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${serverLogName}.%i.log.zip\r\n
    \     </fileNamePattern><minIndex>1</minIndex><maxIndex>9</maxIndex></rollingPolicy><triggeringPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\"><maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize></triggeringPolicy><encoder><pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern></encoder></appender><appender
    name=\"asyncEELFServer\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\"><queueSize>256</queueSize><appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFServer\" /></appender>\r\n   -->\r\n  <!-- EELF Policy Appender. This
    appender is used to record Policy engine\r\n    related logging events. The Policy
    logger and appender are specializations\r\n    of the EELF application root logger
    and appender. This can be used to segregate\r\n    Policy engine events from other
    components, or it can be eliminated to record\r\n    these events as part of the
    application root log. -->\r\n  <!--\r\n  <appender name=\"EELFPolicy\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\"><file>${logDirectory}/${policyLogName}.log</file><rollingPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy\"><fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${policyLogName}.%i.log.zip\r\n
    \     </fileNamePattern><minIndex>1</minIndex><maxIndex>9</maxIndex></rollingPolicy><triggeringPolicy
    class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy\"><maxFileSize>5MB</maxFileSize></triggeringPolicy><encoder><pattern>${defaultPattern}</pattern></encoder></appender><appender
    name=\"asyncEELFPolicy\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\"><queueSize>256</queueSize><appender-ref
    ref=\"EELFPolicy\" /></appender>\r\n  -->\r\n  <!-- EELF Audit Appender. This appender
    is used to record audit engine\r\n    related logging events. The audit logger and
    appender are specializations\r\n    of the EELF application root logger and appender.
    This can be used to segregate\r\n    Policy engine events from other components,
    or it can be eliminated to record\r\n    these events as part of the application
    root log. -->\r\n  <appender name=\"EELFAudit\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n
    \   <file>${logDirectory}/${auditLogName}.log</file>\r\n    <rollingPolicy class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n
    \     <!-- daily rollover -->\r\n      <fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${auditLogName}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log.zip</fileNamePattern>\r\n
    \     <!-- keep 30 days' worth of history capped at 3GB total size -->\r\n      <maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n
    \     <totalSizeCap>3GB</totalSizeCap>\r\n    </rollingPolicy>\r\n    <encoder>\r\n
    \     <pattern>${auditLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n    </encoder>\r\n  </appender>\r\n
    \ <appender name=\"asyncEELFAudit\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n
    \   <queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n    <appender-ref ref=\"EELFAudit\" />\r\n  </appender>\r\n
    \ <appender name=\"EELFMetrics\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n
    \   <file>${logDirectory}/${metricsLogName}.log</file>\r\n    <rollingPolicy class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy\">\r\n
    \     <!-- daily rollover -->\r\n      <fileNamePattern>${logDirectory}/${metricsLogName}.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log.zip</fileNamePattern>\r\n
    \     <!-- keep 30 days' worth of history capped at 3GB total size -->\r\n      <maxHistory>30</maxHistory>\r\n
    \     <totalSizeCap>3GB</totalSizeCap>\r\n    </rollingPolicy>\r\n    <encoder>\r\n
    \     <pattern>${metricsLoggerPattern}</pattern>\r\n    </encoder>\r\n  </appender>\r\n
    \ <appender name=\"asyncEELFMetrics\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.classic.AsyncAppender\">\r\n
    \   <queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n    <appender-ref ref=\"EELFMetrics\"/>\r\n  </appender>\r\n
    \ <appender name=\"EELFError\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n

    \   <queueSize>256</queueSize>\r\n    <appender-ref ref=\"EELFError\"/>\r\n  </appender>\r\n
    \ <appender name=\"EELFDebug\" class=\"ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender\">\r\n

    \ <logger name=\"org.onap.eelf\" level=\"info\" additivity=\"false\">\r\n    <appender-ref
    ref=\"asyncEELF\" />\r\n  </logger>\r\n  <logger name=\"org.onap.eelf.audit\" level=\"info\"

#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.

# limitations under the License.

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: portal-filebeat
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal
    chart: portal-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  filebeat.yml: |
    # Copyright  2018 Amdocs, Bell Canada, AT&T
    #
    # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    # You may obtain a copy of the License at
    #
    #       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
    #
    # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    # limitations under the License.
  
    filebeat.prospectors:
    #it is mandatory, in our case it's log
    - input_type: log
      #This is the canolical path as mentioned in logback.xml, *.* means it will monitor all files in the directory.
      paths:
        - /var/log/onap/*/*/*/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*/*/*.log
        - /var/log/onap/*/*.log
      #Files older than this should be ignored.In our case it will be 48 hours i.e. 2 days. It is a helping flag for clean_inactive
      ignore_older: 48h
      # Remove the registry entry for a file that is more than the specified time. In our case it will be 96 hours, i.e. 4 days. It will help to keep registry records with in limit
      clean_inactive: 96h
  
  
    # Name of the registry file. If a relative path is used, it is considered relative to the
    # data path. Else full qualified file name.
    #filebeat.registry_file: ${path.data}/registry
  
  
    output.logstash:
      #List of logstash server ip addresses with port number.
      #But, in our case, this will be the loadbalancer IP address.
      #For the below property to work the loadbalancer or logstash should expose 5044 port to listen the filebeat events or port in the property should be changed appropriately.
      hosts: ["log-ls:5044"]
      #If enable will do load balancing among availabe Logstash, automatically.
      loadbalance: true
  
      #The list of root certificates for server verifications.
      #If certificate_authorities is empty or not set, the trusted
      #certificate authorities of the host system are used.
      #ssl.certificate_authorities: $ssl.certificate_authorities
  
      #The path to the certificate for SSL client authentication. If the certificate is not specified,
      #client authentication is not available.
      #ssl.certificate: $ssl.certificate
  
      #The client certificate key used for client authentication.
      #ssl.key: $ssl.key
  
      #The passphrase used to decrypt an encrypted key stored in the configured key file
      #ssl.key_passphrase: $ssl.key_passphrase
---
# Source: portal/charts/portal-cassandra/templates/pv.yaml
kind: PersistentVolume
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-cassandra
    chart: "portal-cassandra-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-portal"
    heritage: "Tiller"
    name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra
spec:
  capacity:
    storage: 2Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  hostPath:
    path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-portal/portal/cassandra/data
---
# Source: portal/charts/portal-mariadb/templates/pv.yaml
kind: PersistentVolume
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: dev-portal-portal-db
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-db
    chart: "portal-mariadb-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-portal"
    heritage: "Tiller"
    name: dev-portal-portal-db
spec:
  capacity:
    storage: 2Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  hostPath:
    path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-portal/portal/mariadb/data
---
# Source: portal/charts/portal-cassandra/templates/pvc.yaml
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-cassandra
    chart: "portal-cassandra-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-portal"
    heritage: "Tiller"
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 2Gi
---
# Source: portal/charts/portal-mariadb/templates/pvc.yaml

  namespace: onap

apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: portal-app
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-app
    chart: portal-app-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
  annotations:
    msb.onap.org/service-info: '[
      {
          "serviceName": "portal",
          "version": "v2",
          "url": "/",
          "protocol": "REST"
          "port": "8989",
          "visualRange":"1"
      }
      ]'
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  ports:
    - port: 8989
      targetPort: 8080
      nodePort: 30215
      name: portal-app
    - port: 8006
      targetPort: 8005
      nodePort: 30213
      name: portal-app2
    - port: 8010
      targetPort: 8009
      nodePort: 30214
      name: portal-app3
    - port: 8443
      targetPort: 8443
      nodePort: 30225
      name: portal-app4
  selector:
    app: portal-app
    release: dev-portal
---

apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: portal-cassandra
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-cassandra
    chart: portal-cassandra-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  type: ClusterIP
  ports:
    - port: 9160
      targetPort: 9160
      name: portal-cassandra
    - port: 7000
      targetPort: 7000
      name: portal-cassandra2
    - port: 7001
      targetPort: 7001
      name: portal-cassandra3
    - port: 7199
      targetPort: 7199
      name: portal-cassandra4
    - port: 9042
      targetPort: 9042
      name: portal-cassandra5
  selector:
    app: portal-cassandra
    release: dev-portal
---

# Source: portal/charts/portal-app/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-portal-portal-app
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-app
    chart: portal-app-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: portal-app
        release: dev-portal
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - name: portal-app-job-completion
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: "Always"
        command:
        - /root/job_complete.py
        args:
        - --job-name
        - dev-portal-portal-db-config
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
      containers:
      - name: portal-app
        image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/portal-app:2.6.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        command:
          - /start-apache-tomcat.sh
          - -i
          - ""
          - -n
          - ""
          - -b
          - "/usr/local/tomcat"
        env:
          - name: CATALINA_OPTS
            value: >
              -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore=/usr/local/tomcat/truststoreONAPall.jks
              -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword=changeit
              -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=/usr/local/tomcat/truststoreONAPall.jks
              -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword=changeit
          - name: javax.net.ssl.keyStore
            value: /usr/local/tomcat/truststoreONAPall.jks 
          - name: javax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword
            value: changeit
          - name: javax.net.ssl.trustStore
            value: /usr/local/tomcat/truststoreONAPall.jks
          - name: javax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword
            value: changeit
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        - containerPort: 8005
        - containerPort: 8009
        - containerPort: 8443
        livenessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 8080
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
        readinessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 8080
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/localtime
          name: localtime
          readOnly: true
        - name: properties-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ONAPPORTAL/WEB-INF/fusion/conf/fusion.properties"
          subPath: fusion.properties
        - name: properties-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ONAPPORTAL/WEB-INF/classes/openid-connect.properties"
          subPath: openid-connect.properties
        - name: properties-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ONAPPORTAL/WEB-INF/conf/system.properties"
          subPath: system.properties
        - name: properties-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ONAPPORTAL/WEB-INF/classes/portal.properties"
          subPath: portal.properties
        - name: properties-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ONAPPORTAL/WEB-INF/classes/music.properties"
          subPath: music.properties
        - name: properties-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ONAPPORTAL/WEB-INF/classes/logback.xml"
          subPath: logback.xml
        - name: properties-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/conf/server.xml"
          subPath: server.xml
        - name: authz-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/keystoreONAPPortal.p12"
          subPath: keystoreONAPPortal.p12
        - name: authz-onapportal
          mountPath: "/usr/local/tomcat/truststoreONAPall.jks"
          subPath: truststoreONAPall.jks          
        - name: var-log-onap
          mountPath: /var/log/onap
        resources:
                        {}
                        
      - name: filebeat-onap
        image: "docker.elastic.co/beats/filebeat:5.5.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/filebeat.yml
          name: filebeat-conf
          subPath: filebeat.yml
        - name: portal-data-filebeat
          mountPath: /usr/share/filebeat/data
        - name: var-log-onap
          mountPath: /var/log/onap
      volumes:
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: properties-onapportal
          configMap:
            name: dev-portal-portal-app-onapportal
            defaultMode: 0755
        - name: authz-onapportal
          secret:
            secretName: dev-portal-portal-app-authz-onapportal
        - name: filebeat-conf
          configMap:
            name: portal-filebeat
        - name: var-log-onap
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: portal-data-filebeat
          emptyDir: {}
        - name: portal-tomcat-logs
          emptyDir: {}
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: portal/charts/portal-cassandra/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
# Modifications Copyright  2018 AT&T

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: portal-cassandra
    chart: portal-cassandra-5.0.0
    release: dev-portal
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: portal-cassandra
        release: dev-portal
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: portal-cassandra
        image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/music/cassandra_music:3.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9160
        - containerPort: 7000
        - containerPort: 7001
        - containerPort: 7199
        - containerPort: 9042
        
        livenessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - /bin/bash
            - -c
            - nodetool status | grep $POD_IP | awk '$1!="UN" { exit 1; }'
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
        
        readinessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - /bin/bash
            - -c
            - nodetool status | grep $POD_IP | awk '$1!="UN" { exit 1; }'
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
        env:
          - name: CASSUSER
            value: "root"
          - name: CASSPASS
            value: "Aa123456"
          - name: JVM_OPTS
            value: "-Xmx2536m -Xms2536m"
          - name: POD_IP
            valueFrom:
              fieldRef:
                fieldPath: status.podIP
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/localtime
          name: localtime
          readOnly: true
        - name: cassandra-docker-entrypoint-initdb
          mountPath: /docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/aaa_portal_single.cql
          subPath: portal_single.cql
        - name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra-data
          mountPath: /var/lib/cassandra/data
        resources:
                        {}
                        
      volumes:
        - name: cassandra-docker-entrypoint-initdb
          configMap:
            name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra-docker-entry-initd
        - name: localtime
          hostPath:
            path: /etc/localtime
        - name: dev-portal-portal-cassandra-data
          persistentVolumeClaim:
            claimName: dev-portal-portal-cassandra
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: portal/charts/portal-mariadb/templates/deployment.yaml
# Copyright  2017 Amdocs, Bell Canada
# Modifications Copyright  2018 AT&T
