apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-pgpool-pgpool-configmap
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: vnfsdk-pgpool
    chart: pgpool-5.0.0
    release: dev-vnfsdk
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  pgpool.conf: "# ----------------------------\n# pgPool-II configuration file a custom
    version\n# ----------------------------\n#\n# This file consists of lines of the
    form:\n#\n#   name = value\n#\n# Whitespace may be used.  Comments are introduced
    with \"#\" anywhere on a line.\n# The complete list of parameter names and allowed
    values can be found in the\n# pgPool-II documentation.\n#\n# This file is read on
    server startup and when the server receives a SIGHUP\n# signal.  If you edit the
    file on a running system, you have to SIGHUP the\n# server for the changes to take
    effect, or use \"pgpool reload\".  Some\n# parameters, which are marked below, require
    a server shutdown and restart to\n# take effect.\n#\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    CONNECTIONS\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\n#
    - pgpool Connection Settings -\n\nlisten_addresses = '*'\n                                   #
    Host name or IP address to listen on:\n                                   # '*'
    for all, '' for no TCP/IP connections\n                                   # (change
    requires restart)\n#port = 9999\nport = 5432\n                                   #
    Port number\n                                   # (change requires restart)\nsocket_dir
    = '/tmp'\n                                   # Unix domain socket path\n                                   #
    The Debian package defaults to\n                                   # /var/run/postgresql\n
    \                                  # (change requires restart)\n\n\n# - pgpool Communication
    Manager Connection Settings -\n\npcp_port = 9898\n                                   #
    Port number for pcp\n                                   # (change requires restart)\npcp_socket_dir
    = '/tmp'\n                                   # Unix domain socket path for pcp\n
    \                                  # The Debian package defaults to\n                                   #
    /var/run/postgresql\n                                   # (change requires restart)\n\n#
    - Backend Connection Settings -\n\nbackend_hostname0 = 'pgpool-primary'\nbackend_port0
    = 5432\nbackend_weight0= 1\nbackend_flag0= 'DISALLOW_TO_FAILOVER'\n\nbackend_hostname1
    = 'pgpool-replica'\nbackend_port1 = 5432\nbackend_weight1= 1\nbackend_flag1=
    'DISALLOW_TO_FAILOVER'\n\n#backend_hostname0 = 'master'\n                                   #
    Host name or IP address to connect to for backend 0\n#backend_port0 = 5432\n                                   #
    Port number for backend 0\n#backend_weight0 = 1\n                                   #
    Weight for backend 0 (only in load balancing mode)\n#backend_data_directory0 = '/data'\n
    \                                  # Data directory for backend 0\n#backend_flag0
    = 'ALLOW_TO_FAILOVER'\n                                   # Controls various backend
    behavior\n                                   # ALLOW_TO_FAILOVER or DISALLOW_TO_FAILOVER\n#backend_hostname1
    = 'standby'\n#backend_port1 = 5432\n#backend_weight1 = 1\n#backend_data_directory1
    = '/data1'\n#backend_flag1 = 'ALLOW_TO_FAILOVER'\n\n# - Authentication -\n\nenable_pool_hba
    = on\n                                   # Use pool_hba.conf for client authentication\npool_passwd
    = 'pool_passwd'\n                                   # File name of pool_passwd for
    md5 authentication.\n                                   # \"\" disables pool_passwd.\n
    \                                  # (change requires restart)\nauthentication_timeout
    = 60\n                                   # Delay in seconds to complete client authentication\n
    \                                  # 0 means no timeout.\n\n# - SSL Connections
    -\n\nssl = off\n                                   # Enable SSL support\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n#ssl_key = './server.key'\n                                   #
    Path to the SSL private key file\n                                   # (change requires
    restart)\n#ssl_cert = './server.cert'\n                                   # Path
    to the SSL public certificate file\n                                   # (change
    requires restart)\n#ssl_ca_cert = ''\n                                   # Path
    to a single PEM format file\n                                   # containing CA
    root certificate(s)\n                                   # (change requires restart)\n#ssl_ca_cert_dir
    = ''\n                                   # Directory containing CA root certificate(s)\n
    \                                  # (change requires restart)\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    POOLS\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\n#
    - Pool size -\n\nnum_init_children = 5\n                                   # Number
    of pools\n                                   # (change requires restart)\nmax_pool
    = 1\n                                   # Number of connections per pool\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n\n# - Life time -\n\nchild_life_time = 300\n                                   #
    Pool exits after being idle for this many seconds\nchild_max_connections = 0\n                                   #
    Pool exits after receiving that many connections\n                                   #
    0 means no exit\nconnection_life_time = 0\n                                   #
    Connection to backend closes after being idle for this many seconds\n                                   #
    0 means no close\nclient_idle_limit = 0\n                                   # Client
    is disconnected after being idle for that many seconds\n                                   #
    (even inside an explicit transactions!)\n                                   # 0
    means no disconnection\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    LOGS\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\n#
    - Where to log -\n\nlog_destination = 'stderr'\n                                   #
    Where to log\n                                   # Valid values are combinations
    of stderr,\n                                   # and syslog. Default to stderr.\n\n#
    - What to log -\n\nprint_timestamp = on\n                                   # Print
    timestamp on each line\n                                   # (change requires restart)\n\nlog_connections
    = on\n                                   # Log connections\nlog_hostname = on\n
    \                                  # Hostname will be shown in ps status\n                                   #
    and in logs if connections are logged\nlog_statement = on\n                                   #
    Log all statements\nlog_per_node_statement = off\n                                   #
    Log all statements\n                                   # with node and backend informations\nlog_standby_delay
    = 'if_over_threshold'\n                                   # Log standby delay\n
    \                                  # Valid values are combinations of always,\n
    \                                  # if_over_threshold, none\n\n# - Syslog specific
    -\n\nsyslog_facility = 'LOCAL0'\n                                   # Syslog local
    facility. Default to LOCAL0\nsyslog_ident = 'pgpool'\n                                   #
    Syslog program identification string\n                                   # Default
    to 'pgpool'\n\n# - Debug -\n\ndebug_level = 1\n                                   #
    Debug message verbosity level\n                                   # 0 means no message,
    1 or more mean verbose\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    FILE LOCATIONS\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\npid_file_name
    = '/tmp/pgpool.pid'\n                                   # PID file name\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nlogdir = '/tmp'\n                                   #
    Directory of pgPool status file\n                                   # (change requires
    restart)\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    CONNECTION POOLING\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nconnection_cache
    = off\n                                   # Activate connection pools\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n\n                                   # Semicolon separated
    list of queries\n                                   # to be issued at the end of
    a session\n                                   # The default is for 8.3 and later\nreset_query_list
    = 'ABORT; DISCARD ALL'\n                                   # The following one is
    for 8.2 and before\n#reset_query_list = 'ABORT; RESET ALL; SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION
    DEFAULT'\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    REPLICATION MODE\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nreplication_mode
    = off\n                                   # Activate replication mode\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nreplicate_select = off\n                                   #
    Replicate SELECT statements\n                                   # when in replication
    or parallel mode\n                                   # replicate_select is higher
    priority than\n                                   # load_balance_mode.\n\ninsert_lock
    = off\n                                   # Automatically locks a dummy row or a
    table\n                                   # with INSERT statements to keep SERIAL
    data\n                                   # consistency\n                                   #
    Without SERIAL, no lock will be issued\nlobj_lock_table = ''\n                                   #
    When rewriting lo_creat command in\n                                   # replication
    mode, specify table name to\n                                   # lock\n\n# - Degenerate
    handling -\n\nreplication_stop_on_mismatch = off\n                                   #
    On disagreement with the packet kind\n                                   # sent
    from backend, degenerate the node\n                                   # which is
    most likely \"minority\"\n                                   # If off, just force
    to exit this session\n\nfailover_if_affected_tuples_mismatch = off\n                                   #
    On disagreement with the number of affected\n                                   #
    tuples in UPDATE/DELETE queries, then\n                                   # degenerate
    the node which is most likely\n                                   # \"minority\".\n
    \                                  # If off, just abort the transaction to\n                                   #
    keep the consistency\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    LOAD BALANCING MODE\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nload_balance_mode
    = on\n                                   # Activate load balancing mode\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nignore_leading_white_space = on\n                                   #
    Ignore leading white spaces of each query\nwhite_function_list = ''\n                                   #
    Comma separated list of function names\n                                   # that
    don't write to database\n                                   # Regexp are accepted\nblack_function_list
    = 'currval,lastval,nextval,setval'\n                                   # Comma separated
    list of function names\n                                   # that write to database\n
    \                                  # Regexp are accepted\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    MASTER/SLAVE MODE\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nmaster_slave_mode
    = on\n                                   # Activate master/slave mode\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nmaster_slave_sub_mode = 'stream'\n                                   #
    Master/slave sub mode\n                                   # Valid values are combinations
    slony or\n                                   # stream. Default is slony.\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n\n# - Streaming -\n\nsr_check_period = 10\n                                   #
    Streaming replication check period\n                                   # Disabled
    (0) by default\nsr_check_user = 'postgres'\n                                   #
    Streaming replication check user\n                                   # This is neccessary
    even if you disable streaming\n                                   # replication
    delay check by sr_check_period = 0\nsr_check_password = 'postgres'\n
    \                                  # Password for streaming replication check user\ndelay_threshold
    = 10000000\n                                   # Threshold before not dispatching
    query to standby node\n                                   # Unit is in bytes\n                                   #
    Disabled (0) by default\n\n# - Special commands -\n\nfollow_master_command = ''\n
    \                                  # Executes this command after master failover\n
    \                                  # Special values:\n                                   #
    \  %d = node id\n                                   #   %h = host name\n                                   #
    \  %p = port number\n                                   #   %D = database cluster
    path\n                                   #   %m = new master node id\n                                   #
    \  %H = hostname of the new master node\n                                   #   %M
    = old master node id\n                                   #   %P = old primary node
    id\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   #   %r = new master port number\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   #   %R
    = new master database cluster path\n                                   #   %% =
    '%' character\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    PARALLEL MODE\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nparallel_mode
    = off\n                                   # Activates parallel query mode\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\npgpool2_hostname = ''\n                                   #
    Set pgpool2 hostname\n                                   # (change requires restart)\n\n#
    - System DB info -\n\n#system_db_hostname  = 'localhost'\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n#system_db_port = 5432\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n#system_db_dbname = 'pgpool'\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n#system_db_schema = 'pgpool_catalog'\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n#system_db_user = 'pgpool'\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n#system_db_password = ''\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    HEALTH CHECK\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nhealth_check_period
    = 20\n                                   # Health check period\n                                   #
    Disabled (0) by default\nhealth_check_timeout = 10\n                                   #
    Health check timeout\n                                   # 0 means no timeout\nhealth_check_user
    = 'postgres'\n                                   # Health
    check user\nhealth_check_password = 'postgres'\n                                   #
    Password for health check user\nhealth_check_max_retries = 3\nconnect_timeout =
    10000 \t\t# Timeout value in milliseconds before giving up to connect to backend.\n\n
    \                                  # Maximum number of times to retry a failed health
    check before giving up.\nhealth_check_retry_delay = 1\n                                   #
    Amount of time to wait (in seconds) between retries.\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    FAILOVER AND FAILBACK\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nfailover_command
    = ''\n                                   # Executes this command at failover\n                                   #
    Special values:\n                                   #   %d = node id\n                                   #
    \  %h = host name\n                                   #   %p = port number\n                                   #
    \  %D = database cluster path\n                                   #   %m = new master
    node id\n                                   #   %H = hostname of the new master
    node\n                                   #   %M = old master node id\n                                   #
    \  %P = old primary node id\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   #   %r = new master port number\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  #   %R = new master database cluster path\n                                   #
    \  %% = '%' character\nfailback_command = ''\n                                   #
    Executes this command at failback.\n                                   # Special
    values:\n                                   #   %d = node id\n                                   #
    \  %h = host name\n                                   #   %p = port number\n                                   #
    \  %D = database cluster path\n                                   #   %m = new master
    node id\n                                   #   %H = hostname of the new master
    node\n                                   #   %M = old master node id\n                                   #
    \  %P = old primary node id\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   #   %r = new master port number\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  #   %R = new master database cluster path\n                                   #
    \  %% = '%' character\n\nfail_over_on_backend_error = off\n                                   #
    Initiates failover when reading/writing to the\n                                   #
    backend communication socket fails\n                                   # If set
    to off, pgpool will report an\n                                   # error and disconnect
    the session.\n\nsearch_primary_node_timeout = 10\n                                   #
    Timeout in seconds to search for the\n                                   # primary
    node when a failover occurs.\n                                   # 0 means no timeout,
    keep searching\n                                   # for a primary node forever.\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    ONLINE RECOVERY\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\nrecovery_user
    = 'postgres'\n                                   # Online
    recovery user\nrecovery_password = 'postgres'\n                                   #
    Online recovery password\nrecovery_1st_stage_command = ''\n                                   #
    Executes a command in first stage\nrecovery_2nd_stage_command = ''\n                                   #
    Executes a command in second stage\nrecovery_timeout = 90\n                                   #
    Timeout in seconds to wait for the\n                                   # recovering
    node's postmaster to start up\n                                   # 0 means no wait\nclient_idle_limit_in_recovery
    = 0\n                                   # Client is disconnected after being idle\n
    \                                  # for that many seconds in the second stage\n
    \                                  # of online recovery\n                                   #
    0 means no disconnection\n                                   # -1 means immediate
    disconnection\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    WATCHDOG\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n\n#
    - Enabling -\n\nuse_watchdog = off\n                                    # Activates
    watchdog\n                                    # (change requires restart)\n\n# -Connection
    to up stream servers -\n\ntrusted_servers = ''\n                                    #
    trusted server list which are used\n                                    # to confirm
    network connection\n                                    # (hostA,hostB,hostC,...)\n
    \                                   # (change requires restart)\nping_path = '/bin'\n
    \                                   # ping command path\n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\n\n# - Watchdog communication Settings -\n\nwd_hostname
    = ''\n                                    # Host name or IP address of this watchdog\n
    \                                   # (change requires restart)\nwd_port = 9000\n
    \                                   # port number for watchdog service\n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\nwd_authkey = ''\n                                    #
    Authentication key for watchdog communication\n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\n\n# - Virtual IP control Setting -\n\ndelegate_IP = ''\n
    \                                   # delegate IP address\n                                    #
    If this is empty, virtual IP never bring up. \n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\nifconfig_path = '/sbin'\n                                    #
    ifconfig command path\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nif_up_cmd
    = 'ifconfig eth0:0 inet $_IP_$ netmask 255.255.255.0'\n                                    #
    startup delegate IP command\n                                    # (change requires
    restart)\nif_down_cmd = 'ifconfig eth0:0 down'\n                                    #
    shutdown delegate IP command\n                                    # (change requires
    restart)\n\narping_path = '/usr/sbin'           # arping command path\n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\n\narping_cmd = 'arping -U $_IP_$ -w 1'\n                                    #
    arping command\n                                    # (change requires restart)\n\n#
    - Behaivor on escalation Setting -\n\nclear_memqcache_on_escalation = on\n                                    #
    Clear all the query cache on shared memory\n                                    #
    when standby pgpool escalate to active pgpool\n                                    #
    (= virtual IP holder).\n                                    # This should be off
    if client connects to pgpool\n                                    # not using virtual
    IP.\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nwd_escalation_command
    = ''\n                                    # Executes this command at escalation
    on new active pgpool.\n                                    # (change requires restart)\n\n#
    - Lifecheck Setting - \n\n# -- common --\n\nwd_lifecheck_method = 'heartbeat'\n
    \                                   # Method of watchdog lifecheck ('heartbeat'
    or 'query')\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nwd_interval
    = 10\n                                    # lifecheck interval (sec) > 0\n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\n\n# -- heartbeat mode --\n\nwd_heartbeat_port = 9694\n
    \                                   # Port number for receiving heartbeat signal\n
    \                                   # (change requires restart)\nwd_heartbeat_keepalive
    = 2\n                                    # Interval time of sending heartbeat signal
    (sec)\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nwd_heartbeat_deadtime
    = 30\n                                    # Deadtime interval for heartbeat signal
    (sec)\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nheartbeat_destination0
    = 'host0_ip1'\n                                    # Host name or IP address of
    destination 0\n                                    # for sending heartbeat signal.\n
    \                                   # (change requires restart)\nheartbeat_destination_port0
    = 9694 \n                                    # Port number of destination 0 for
    sending\n                                    # heartbeat signal. Usually this is
    the\n                                    # same as wd_heartbeat_port.\n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\nheartbeat_device0 = ''\n                                    #
    Name of NIC device (such like 'eth0')\n                                    # used
    for sending/receiving heartbeat\n                                    # signal to/from
    destination 0.\n                                    # This works only when this
    is not empty\n                                    # and pgpool has root privilege.\n
    \                                   # (change requires restart)\n\n#heartbeat_destination1
    = 'host0_ip2'\n#heartbeat_destination_port1 = 9694\n#heartbeat_device1 = ''\n\n#
    -- query mode --\n\nwd_life_point = 3\n                                    # lifecheck
    retry times\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nwd_lifecheck_query
    = 'SELECT 1'\n                                    # lifecheck query to pgpool from
    watchdog\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nwd_lifecheck_dbname
    = 'template1'\n                                    # Database name connected for
    lifecheck\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nwd_lifecheck_user
    = 'nobody'\n                                    # watchdog user monitoring pgpools
    in lifecheck\n                                    # (change requires restart)\nwd_lifecheck_password
    = ''\n                                    # Password for watchdog user in lifecheck\n
    \                                   # (change requires restart)\n\n# - Other pgpool
    Connection Settings -\n\n#other_pgpool_hostname0 = 'host0'\n                                    #
    Host name or IP address to connect to for other pgpool 0\n                                    #
    (change requires restart)\n#other_pgpool_port0 = 5432\n                                    #
    Port number for othet pgpool 0\n                                    # (change requires
    restart)\n#other_wd_port0 = 9000\n                                    # Port number
    for othet watchdog 0\n                                    # (change requires restart)\n#other_pgpool_hostname1
    = 'host1'\n#other_pgpool_port1 = 5432\n#other_wd_port1 = 9000\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    OTHERS\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\nrelcache_expire
    = 0\n                                   # Life time of relation cache in seconds.\n
    \                                  # 0 means no cache expiration(the default).\n
    \                                  # The relation cache is used for cache the\n
    \                                  # query result against PostgreSQL system\n                                   #
    catalog to obtain various information\n                                   # including
    table structures or if it's a\n                                   # temporary table
    or not. The cache is\n                                   # maintained in a pgpool
    child local memory\n                                   # and being kept as long
    as it survives.\n                                   # If someone modify the table
    by using\n                                   # ALTER TABLE or some such, the relcache
    is\n                                   # not consistent anymore.\n                                   #
    For this purpose, cache_expiration\n                                   # controls
    the life time of the cache.\nrelcache_size = 256\n                                   #
    Number of relation cache\n                                   # entry. If you see
    frequently:\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # \"pool_search_relcache: cache replacement happend\"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # in the pgpool log, you might want to increate this number.\n\ncheck_temp_table
    = on\n                                   # If on, enable temporary table check in
    SELECT statements.\n                                   # This initiates queries
    against system catalog of primary/master\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # thus increases load
    of master.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # If you are absolutely sure that your system never
    uses temporary tables\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # and you want to save access to primary/master,
    you could turn this off.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Default is on.\n\n\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n#
    ON MEMORY QUERY MEMORY CACHE\n#------------------------------------------------------------------------------\nmemory_cache_enabled
    = off\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # If on, use the memory cache functionality, off by default\nmemqcache_method
    = 'shmem'\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Cache storage method. either 'shmem'(shared memory)
    or\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # 'memcached'. 'shmem' by default\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_memcached_host = 'localhost'\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # Memcached host name or IP address. Mandatory if\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # memqcache_method
    = 'memcached'.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Defaults to localhost.\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_memcached_port = 11211\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   #
    Memcached port number. Mondatory if memqcache_method = 'memcached'.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # Defaults to 11211.\n                                   # (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_total_size
    = 67108864\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Total memory size in bytes for storing memory cache.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # Mandatory if memqcache_method = 'shmem'.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Defaults to
    64MB.\n                                   # (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_max_num_cache
    = 1000000\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Total number of cache entries. Mandatory\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # if memqcache_method = 'shmem'.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Each cache entry consumes
    48 bytes on shared memory.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Defaults to 1,000,000(45.8MB).\n
    \                                  # (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_expire
    = 0\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Memory cache entry life time specified in seconds.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # 0 means infinite life time. 0 by default.\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_auto_cache_invalidation = on\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # If on, invalidation of query cache is triggered by corresponding\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # DDL/DML/DCL(and memqcache_expire).  If off, it is only triggered\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
    \  # by memqcache_expire.  on by default.\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_maxcache = 409600\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Maximum
    SELECT result size in bytes.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Must be smaller than memqcache_cache_block_size.
    Defaults to 400KB.\n                                   # (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_cache_block_size
    = 1048576\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Cache block size in bytes. Mandatory if memqcache_method
    = 'shmem'.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t   # Defaults to 1MB.\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nmemqcache_oiddir = '/var/log/pgpool/oiddir'\n\t\t\t\t
    \  \t\t\t\t   # Temporary work directory to record table oids\n                                   #
    (change requires restart)\nwhite_memqcache_table_list = ''\n                                   #
    Comma separated list of table names to memcache\n                                   #
    that don't write to database\n                                   # Regexp are accepted\nblack_memqcache_table_list
    = ''\n                                   # Comma separated list of table names not
    to memcache\n                                   # that don't write to database\n
    \                                  # Regexp are accepted\n"
  pool_hba.conf: |
    # pgpool Client Authentication Configuration File a custom version
    # ===============================================
    #
    # The format rule in this file follows the rules in the PostgreSQL
    # Administrator's Guide. Refer to chapter "Client Authentication" for a
    # complete description.  A short synopsis follows.
    #
    # This file controls: which hosts are allowed to connect, how clients
    # are authenticated, which user names they can use, which databases they
    # can access.  Records take one of these forms:
    #
    # local      DATABASE  USER  METHOD  [OPTION]
    # host       DATABASE  USER  CIDR-ADDRESS  METHOD  [OPTION]
    #
    # (The uppercase items must be replaced by actual values.)
    #
    # The first field is the connection type: "local" is a Unix-domain
    # socket, "host" is either a plain or SSL-encrypted TCP/IP socket.
    #
    # DATABASE can be "all", "sameuser", a database name, or a comma-separated
    # list thereof. Note that "samegroup" like in PostgreSQL's pg_hba.conf
    # file is not supported, since pgpool does not know which group a user
    # belongs to. Also note that the database specified here may not exist in
    # the backend PostgreSQL. pgpool will authenticate based on the database's
    # name, not based on whether it exists or not.
    #
    # USER can be "all", a user name, or a comma-separated list thereof.  In
    # both the DATABASE and USER fields you can also write a file name prefixed
    # with "@" to include names from a separate file. Note that a group name
    # prefixed with "+" like in PostgreSQL's pg_hba.conf file is not supported
    # because of the same reason as "samegroup" token. Also note that a user
    # name specified here may not exist in the backend PostgreSQL. pgpool will
    # authenticate based on the user's name, not based on whether he/she exists.
    #
    # CIDR-ADDRESS specifies the set of hosts the record matches.
    # It is made up of an IP address and a CIDR mask that is an integer
    # (between 0 and 32 (IPv4) that specifies the number of significant bits in
    # the mask.  Alternatively, you can write an IP address and netmask in
    # separate columns to specify the set of hosts.
    #
    # METHOD can be "trust", "reject", "md5" or "pam".  Note that "pam" sends passwords
    # in clear text.
    #
    # OPTION is the name of the PAM service. Default service name is "pgpool"
    #
    # Database and user names containing spaces, commas, quotes and other special
    # characters must be quoted. Quoting one of the keywords "all" or "sameuser"
    # makes the name lose its special character, and just match a database or
    # username with that name.
    #
    # This file is read on pgpool startup.  If you edit the file on a running
    # system, you have to restart the pgpool  for the changes to take effect.
  
    # Put your actual configuration here
    # ----------------------------------
    #
    # If you want to allow non-local connections, you need to add more
    # "host" records. In that case you will also need to make pgpool listen
    # on a non-local interface via the listen_addresses configuration parameter.
    #
  
    # TYPE  DATABASE    USER        CIDR-ADDRESS          METHOD
  
    # "local" is for Unix domain socket connections only
    #local   all         all                               trust
    # IPv4 local connections:
    host    all         all         0.0.0.0/0          md5
  pool_passwd: |
    testuser:md599e8713364988502fa6189781bcf648f
    postgres:md53175bce1d3201d16594cebf9d7eb3f9d
---

apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: vnfsdk
    chart: vnfsdk-5.0.0
    release: dev-vnfsdk
    heritage: Tiller
data:
  marketplace_tables_postgres.sql: |
    CREATE DATABASE "marketplaceDB";
  
    \c marketplaceDB;
  
    DROP TABLE IF EXISTS CSAR_PACKAGE_TABLE;
  
    CREATE TABLE CSAR_PACKAGE_TABLE (
            CSARID                   VARCHAR(200)       NOT NULL,
            DOWNLOADURI              VARCHAR(200)       NULL,
            REPORT                       VARCHAR(200)       NULL,
            SIZE                     VARCHAR(100)       NULL,
            FORMAT                   VARCHAR(100)       NULL,
            CREATETIME               VARCHAR(100)       NULL,
            DELETIONPENDING          VARCHAR(100)       NULL,
            MODIFYTIME               VARCHAR(100)       NULL,
            SHORTDESC                    TEXT                       NULL,
            NAME                     VARCHAR(100)       NULL,
            VERSION                  VARCHAR(20)        NULL,
            PROVIDER                 VARCHAR(300)       NULL,
            TYPE                     VARCHAR(300)       NULL,
            DETAILS                      TEXT                           NULL,
            REMARKS                      TEXT                           NULL,
            DOWNLOADCOUNT            INT                NULL,
            CONSTRAINT csar_package_table_pkey PRIMARY KEY (CSARID)
    );
---

kind: PersistentVolume
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-data0
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres
    chart: "postgres-5.0.0"
    release: "dev-vnfsdk"
    heritage: "Tiller"
    name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres
spec:
  capacity:
    storage: 1Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  storageClassName: "dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-data"
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  hostPath:
    path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-vnfsdk/vnfsdk/data0

apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: refrepo
  namespace: onap

    app: vnfsdk
    chart: vnfsdk-5.0.0
    release: dev-vnfsdk
    heritage: Tiller

# Source: vnfsdk/charts/postgres/charts/pgpool/templates/deployment.yaml
kind: Deployment
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
metadata:
  name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-pgpool
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: vnfsdk-pgpool
    chart: pgpool-5.0.0
    release: dev-vnfsdk
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  replicas: 2
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: vnfsdk-pgpool
        release: dev-vnfsdk
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: "crunchydata/crunchy-pgpool:centos7-10.4-2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: vnfsdk-pgpool
        env:
        - name: PG_PRIMARY_SERVICE_NAME
          value: pgpool-primary
        - name: PG_REPLICA_SERVICE_NAME
          value: pgpool-replica
        - name: PG_USERNAME
          value: postgres
        - name: PG_PASSWORD
          value: postgres
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5432
          name: pgpool
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 5432
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
          periodSeconds: 10
        livenessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 5432
        initialDelaySeconds: 15
        periodSeconds: 20
        volumeMounts:
        - name: pgpool-pgconf
          mountPath: /pgconf/pgpoolconfigdir
          readOnly: false
      volumes:
      - name: pgpool-pgconf
        configMap:
          name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-pgpool-pgpool-configmap
---
# Source: vnfsdk/templates/deployment.yaml

apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: vnfsdk
    chart: vnfsdk-5.0.0
    release: dev-vnfsdk
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: vnfsdk
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: vnfsdk
        release: dev-vnfsdk
      name: vnfsdk
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - "vnfsdk-postgres"
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: vnfsdk-readiness
      containers:
      - image: "nexus3.onap.org:10001/onap/vnfsdk/refrepo:1.3.2"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: vnfsdk
        resources:
                        {}
                        
        env:
        - name: POSTGRES_SERVICE_HOST
          value: "$(VNFSDK_DBSET_SERVICE_HOST)"
        readinessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 8702
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
---
# Source: vnfsdk/charts/postgres/templates/statefulset.yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1beta1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: vnfsdk-postgres
    chart: postgres-5.0.0
    release: dev-vnfsdk
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  serviceName: vnfsdk-dbset
  replicas: 2
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: vnfsdk-postgres
        release: dev-vnfsdk
    spec:
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        - |
          for i in $(seq 0 $((2-1))); do
            if [ ! -d /podroot/data$i ]; then
              mkdir -p /podroot/data$i;
              chown 26:26 /podroot/data$i;
              chmod 700 /podroot/data$i;
            fi;
          done
        env:
        - name: POD_NAME
          valueFrom: { fieldRef: { fieldPath: metadata.name } }
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        image: registry.hub.docker.com/library/busybox:latest
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: init-sysctl
        volumeMounts:
        - name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-init
          mountPath: /podroot/
      containers:
      - name: vnfsdk-postgres
        image: "crunchydata/crunchy-postgres:centos7-10.4-2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5432
          name: postgres
        # disable liveness probe when breakpoints set in debugger
        # so K8s doesn't restart unresponsive container
        livenessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 5432
          initialDelaySeconds: 300
          periodSeconds: 10
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        readinessProbe:
          tcpSocket:
            port: 5432
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
        env:
        - name: PGHOST
          value: /tmp
        - name: PG_PRIMARY_USER
          value: primaryuser
        - name: PG_MODE
          value: set
        - name: PG_PRIMARY_HOST
          value: "vnfsdk-dbpri"
        - name: PG_REPLICA_HOST
          value: "vnfsdk-dbrep"
        - name: PG_PRIMARY_PORT
          value: "5432"
        - name: PG_PRIMARY_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres
              key: pg-primary-password
        - name: PG_USER
          value: "postgres"
        - name: PG_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres
              key: pg-user-password
        - name: PG_DATABASE
          value: "postgres"
        - name: PG_ROOT_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres
              key: pg-root-password
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /pgdata
          name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-data
        - mountPath: /backup
          name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-backup
          readOnly: true
        resources:
                        null
                        
      volumes:
      - name: localtime
        hostPath:
          path: /etc/localtime
      - name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-init
        hostPath:
          path: /dockerdata-nfs/dev-vnfsdk/vnfsdk
      - name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-backup
        emptyDir: {}
#
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-data
      labels:
        name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres
    spec:
      accessModes: [ ReadWriteOnce ]
      storageClassName: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres-data
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 1Gi
      selector:
        matchLabels:
          name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-postgres

apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: Job
metadata:
  name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk-init-postgres
  namespace: onap
  labels:
    app: vnfsdk-job
    chart: vnfsdk-5.0.0
    release: dev-vnfsdk
    heritage: Tiller
spec:
  backoffLimit: 20
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: vnfsdk-job
        release: dev-vnfsdk
    spec:
      restartPolicy: Never
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /root/ready.py
        args:
        - --container-name
        - "vnfsdk-postgres"
        env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: "oomk8s/readiness-check:2.0.0"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: vnfsdk-readiness
      containers:
      - name: vnfsdk-job
        image: "crunchydata/crunchy-postgres:centos7-10.3-1.8.2"
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        env:
        - name: PGPASSWORD
          value: "postgres"
        command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        - |
          psql -U postgres -h $(VNFSDK_DBPRI_SERVICE_HOST) -f /aaa/init/marketplace_tables_postgres.sql
        volumeMounts:
        - name: init-data
          mountPath: /aaa/init/marketplace_tables_postgres.sql
          subPath: marketplace_tables_postgres.sql
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: "onap-docker-registry-key"
      volumes:
      - name: init-data
        configMap:
          name: dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk

1. Get the application URL by running these commands:
  export NODE_PORT=$(kubectl get --namespace onap -o jsonpath="{.spec.ports[0].nodePort}" services dev-vnfsdk-vnfsdk)
  export NODE_IP=$(kubectl get nodes --namespace onap -o jsonpath="{.items[0].status.addresses[0].address}")
  echo http://$NODE_IP:$NODE_PORT
